description:
The hidden restaurant under Nordstroms! I was pleasantly surprised to have such a good experience here being it was my first time eating here and having lived in SF all my life. My coworkers recommended this place and it was a great place for our big group. 

You order at the register, pay, and get seated. Then a server comes to serve drinks to you and your food as well. 

My friend and I shared the spicy shrimp pasta dish and it was good, not very spicy. I mentioned that I was going to share the dish with my friend at the register and they brought out two separate bowls for us so that was nice! The serving size is definitely on the smaller side but I felt full after. My coworkers ordered the margarita pizza and it looked amazing too. Everything looked fresh and delicious. 

Service is super friendly and attentive. I appreciate how kind they were even though we were staying a little close towards their closing time. 

I am leaning towards coming back to try other dishes!
author: Debby N.

description: Always amazing. Great service, great food, great price. Can't beat for what ya get. Never had a bad experience here and I have probably been here about 30,000 times. Great for a bite before or after shopping. I just come here to eat though .
author: Cristiano L.

description:
Update: Don't try the Tiramisu as it is all cream and does not taste like one at all, I couldn't take one bite, refer to the attached picture.
Great food and staff. Clean place with great service. Love it. Try any of their salads, they are all great. Don't forget the tea and their huge portions of sweets. Don't forget to ask for bread and butter and honey and lemon for your tea.
author: Mehran A.

description:
There is always a line for this place and for good reason! Ingredients are fresh and tasty. This restaurant is probably one of the healthier options inside Stonestown. 

My favorite dish is the skirt steak. I don't generally enjoy skirt steaks, but they cook it perfectly. The chimichurri and potatoes complete the meal. This dish is $18+ pre-tax. You may not be getting the most bang for your buck here as portion size is on the smaller end, but I never feel grossly full afterwards either. Instead, I feel I've consumed delicious food that is good for my body, and makes me pleasantly full. 

Located on the bottom floor of Nordstrom, you can't miss it as there will most likely be a line during lunch/dinner hours. You line up, place your order and pay, then take your receipt to a table of your choosing. A server will come by and put your order in. I've always enjoyed the service as they are usually sweet, elderly folks! The only part that turns me away from dining here is the crowd! Otherwise, it is usually my first dining choice within Stonestown!
author: Kristi T.

description: After half a day of shopping at the mall, Marketplace was a welcome pit stop to give the legs some rest and to fuel up. I enjoyed my pizza and salad.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Located in the lowest level Nordstrom at Stonestown and better than fast food, this is certainly more expensive yet convenient.

Order at the register and your food will be brought to your table. Everything on the menu has a calorie count next to it.

At $12.25 I tried the Santa Fe' Chicken Sandwich with a simple side salad. Although it bears no resemblance to anything I've had in Santa Fe', it wasn't bad. I think it was sliced processed chicken breast.  It arrived on what looked and tasted like toasted white bread with aioli, avocado, bell pepper, caramelized onion and cheese.  The accompanying side salad was just a bite with a few croutons, a cherry tomato then dusted with Parmesan. 

At $17.50 the Salmon with roasted Vegetables and Farro was a bit overpriced and dry. I've never had anything like the Veggies Farro before so it's difficult to describe. It's more like a salad, red and yellow bell pepper mixed up and then sprinkled with a little Parmesan, not my favorite. I honestly don't know if I eat here again.
author: Caesar A.

description:
I am a regular here and it saddens me that they have changed their menu. There is no need to fix something that is not broken. Everyone I know misses some dishes from the old menu and this is a tragedy considering I have been going here since I was in middle school. 

I understand that some people like change, but this seems to have changed for the worst. I came here today with my sister and we both decided to eat somewhere else because nothing on the menu looked or sounded appetizing. 

I will return when this place decides to bring back their old menu. If they ever do.
author: Kailey H.

description: Somewhat disappointing. My wife had the roasted salmon which turned out very dry and overcooked. I ordered the skirt steak which was bland and on the tough side. This restaurant is in the basement of the Nordstrom Store and it shows - it is tired looking and the process of ordering and food delivery is overly  complicated.
author: Thomas C K.

description:
What a great place in Stonestown Mall!  Our friend suggested we meet here so I got there a little early.  It's a huge restaurant with tons of tables and booths.  

You have to order at a counter first, and then you seat yourself.  A server will come to you, check your receipt and then bring the food/drinks to you.  I was impressed at what a nice cafe this was.  Quiet, clean, comfortable.

I ordered a french dip sandwich and it was FABULOUS.  Great service, great food, great place to meet up with friends.  A hidden gem in a very busy and crowded city!
author: Annette H.

description:
This is by far my favorite Nordstrom Cafe. If you're looking for one with more options, the one in Westfield Mall downtown is the place to go since it is an actual restaurant. I like to go to this one because you don't have to wait. You just order at the register and they bring your food to you.

It's located at the bottom floor near kid's clothes and lingerie. They close around 7pm. My favorites here are the chinese chicken salad, chicken caesar salad, and the angel hair pasta with salmon and asparagus (which has unfortunately been discontinued since last year... *cries*). I never crave pasta and don't really like it, but that angel hair pasta was one of the few exceptions. It was SO good. They occasionally have it as their weekly special nowadays but I wish they still had it on the menu! The chinese chicken salad has the perfect balance of dressing, vegetables, and lettuce - it's my favorite here. You can also order a half order of their salads, just in case you just want it as a side for your main meal. 

They always offer you bread while you wait. You either get the typical sourdough or you might be lucky and get these crispy cheesy breads that are delish!

Complimentary mint chocolates at the end of your meal! I like how you pay ahead of time so once you finish eating, you don't have to worry about flagging down a waiter for the check and you can just leave.
author: Sydney C.

description: I was in San Francisco and decided to stop at Nordstrom and have lunch at the Café.  The line was really long as it was right around 12pm.  They only had one cashier and she seemed new so she was quite slow.  Definitely needed to get another cashier to move things along.  I finally ordered and took a seat at a nice corner table.  I ordered the prosciutto and arugula pizza with pesto sauce.  And a snickerdoodle cookie.  The pizza came pretty quickly.  It was tasty but a bit greasy. Loved the pesto sauce.  It was very garlicky.  Also, I took the cookie to go and ate it later.  It definitely was not a snickerdoodle cookie.  It was tasteless sugar cookie.  Normally I like Nordstrom Cafes a bit better.  Maybe it was just a busy day. I definitely prefer their other locations.
author: Karen C.

description: Wow -- awesome display of rudeness & lack of any knowledge of customer service by whoever is working the register out front. We went in with shopping bags in tow and just tried to sit down to decide what we wanted to eat. Yes, we've been here several times before & know that you order up front. But the lady up front was all "you shall not pass". And we're like "fine, we'll leave". And she's all "fine, then leave". And we left. Restaurant literally empty. No small wonder. Your food isn't that good to treat people like this.
author: michl ..

description:
I have eaten here enough times to justify my two star review. I've been "semi-frequenting" the Nordstrom Cafe or now to my revelation, is now called "Marketplace Cafe" since I was in my teens; The Menu and everything else still says "Cafe Nordstrom" .. Anyway The food isn't very good, the waiters, waitresses and busboys are mostly friendly and give decent to good service but as far as the food goes, it reminds me of a greasy spoon that is a little overpriced. 

You order at the front before you are seated, pay and then go and find a vacant table for yourself. A waitress shows up to serve you and you leave 15-20% tip. My dad leaves 10% but it is widely known throughout the midwest; .. or the Bay Area that the old man is a super cheap guy! just embarrassing because sometimes it actually works out to less than 10%

As I said the food is not very good, you're mainly getting cheep greasy food with the added benefit of dining in a nice restaurant atmosphere. I've tried a lot of things on the menu despite only patronizing this place a couple to a few times a year and I have concluded that it is at least slightly overpriced with nothing particularly good on the menu. It's just one of a couple of places at Stonestown where you feel that you're eating at a restaurant and not at the food court or McDonald's. The other place being The Olive Garden. Chevy's closed a few years back and is now occupied by Chipotle and Peet's Coffee. 

I never had an opinion strong enough to leave a positive or negative review on this place in the past, but today I went there with my niece right around the busy lunchtime hours at around 1-1:30 PM and it was so crowded when we first got there with a huge line and no available tables that I thought for sure we would go somewhere else but after my niece played with Christmas toys just outside for a half hour to 45 minutes, the line actually died down and I saw some tables so we had lunch there after all. 

I was kind of nervous about ordering and getting a table, trying to read the menu and the kids menu all while keeping an eye on my niece, so I looked at the menu and I tried all the other sandwiches, except for the Chipotle Grilled Cheese so with having ten seconds to decide opted for the "Chipotle White Cheddar Grilled Cheese sandwich with aged cheddar and jack, roasted tomato, chipotle spread on crisp country bread" .. Sounds fancy and for 10.50 it should be some kind of souped up grilled cheese, but when it arrived at my table, I thought wow! this is almost like a kids menu item or a homemade grilled cheese. It was basically two slices of bread with some cheese in-between. No lettuce, tomato or any other condiment that would justify the price. I did not care for the chipotle flavor either. I could feel the weight of it just picking it up; "this is a kids menu item at best" served with some kettle chips.

I can't remember everything I've had here over the years or decades but from recent memory, the other sandwiches are not very good either! The chicken club, the French dip, the Panini's all disappointing; Boudin's makes better sandwiches! but the grilled cheese is an absolute joke for what they charge! that's like a buck fifty in ingredients. I have also recently had the Salmon which is also not very good, overcooked dry and greasy. It is very rare for me not to enjoy a salmon dish but this place pulled that off as well. Pasta dishes are also not very good, I have never tried any of their personal pizzas here but I wish I ordered one today as they are only a few dollars more than the pathetic grilled cheese that I ordered. The (non refill) $3 glass of coke was extremely watered-down. My niece ordered the "Pasta in tomato cheese sauce" which is basically Mac and Cheese with tomato based pasta sauce. She said she liked what she ordered but she's sevn years old and just like Mikey from the old Life cereal commercials, she likes everything.
author: David A.

description:
I have been here for years and I never reeally thought about writing a review but i feel like i have to after my experience with the customer service today. 
This place is a great place to grab lunch or dinner and the food is consistently good. 
However, definitely 5 stars for the service  given to our waiter Oliver. It's a busy day for him but he is giving his best service to all the customers with such a great attitude and smile. 
Good food + Great service = priceless
author: Irene T.

description:
Marketplace cafe at stonestown is the worst cafe place; I used to come to this place many times and I am ok to wait for a bit but we were waiting for our food for over 40 minutes; people came after us had their food already. It is very unfortunate that they are going to loose one of their loyal customers and I will never go back to this cafe again.

Stay away from this cafe and I will rather eat some where else.
author: Steve L.

description:
Love this place!! I didn't know they're named Marketplace cafe now?? (What happened to the simple Nordstrom Cafe? Haha..) 

I love this place for their salads (Chinese Chicken Salad and Cilantro Lime Chicken are a few of my/bf/bff's favorites). Their pastas are yummy too, one of my favorites being the Spicy Shrimp & Angel Hair Pasta... jumbo sized shrimp on wonderfully spiced and flavorful tomato-based angel hair pasta! Of their specialty dishes, I love their Tuscany Roasted Salmon; salmon is cooked SO moist and flakey, served with potatoes and huge chunks of roasted vegetables! 

Service has always been pleasant, with complimentary chocolate mints at the end. This place is a great casual yet wonderful dining experience; I've also seen people come here with laptops to get some work or studying done, too! 

I come here not only while I'm conveniently shopping at the mall, but also when I'm not shopping and is just craving a simple and delicious meal!
author: Kris C.

description:
My daughter loves the penne pasta with tomato sauce at this Nordstrom's cafe. Great portions and the employees are real friendly.

Wish they would bring back. The pasta Stroganoff that they had back- it was indeed tasty and filling!
author: kyra d.

description:
I would go here if i am not in the mood for food court. Its located at the lower of Nordstrom store. Whenever i go here, the food is always consistent which allow me to enjoy my food. You have to pay at the cashier first if you decided to to dine in after you decide what you want to eat and sit wherever you want. The waiter or waitress would come to you and check your receipt to see what food you get so they can get your food. They usually bring your food out within 10 minutes if its not busy. I usually get the angel hair pasta with salmon and asparagus or braise pot roast beef with egg noodle. Of course whenever you order pasta, its usually over $10. Its the average price for this restaurant. Its always have plenty of flavor and enough to get you full. They usually give you candy once they bring your receipt back.

Very clean and spacious. Friendly staffs. Like i mention in the tip, this place closes at 7:30 pm instead of 7 on weekday
author: Julie N.

description:
Love this place for a quick stop while shopping instead of mall food. 
There are lots of older people who are regulars and staffed nice but lacks some customer service skills compared to all other Nords restaurants/cafes. 
They really need help with no regulars or regulars besides old ladies who are treated like queens which is great but hello treat the fresh blood well so we want to come back when we are old okay?!?
My portion of food today was ridiculous small for a special I have had at other locations. It's about half the size of the downtown restaurant which is super fabulous and classy compared to this. It makes this seem like Denny's.
author: Keli D.

description: This is a nice hideaway at Nordstrom where you can have a lite snack or a hearty lunch entree in between shopping.  Parking in the parking structure gives you direct access to the store and this cafe.  Likes?  Ordering up front and then sitting at the table.  Food is brought to you.  Forget anything, like dessert or tea?  They will add it to your order and bring it to you.  Today, I am enjoying Poblano chicken mac and cheese.  Other items to consider are the Niçoise salad with wild salmon or their penne Bolognese.  In a hurry to get back to your shopping?  Order a cup of coffee to go!
author: Jeff P.

description:
This little gem is tucked on the lower level of the Nordstrom at the Stonestown Galleria. I have only started going recently after trying some of their selections from the menu.

It's a nice little cafe with lots of seating. You order at the front, pay, & choose where you want to sit. The servers will then bring your food to your table once ready. 

Their menu is small but has lots of variety. From soups to salads to pastas and entrees. All sound quite delicious actually. 

What I Ordered:

* Nicoise Salad w/ Roasted Salmon: My ultimate favorite! Lots of fresh ingredients (roasted potatoes, capers, red onion, cherry tomato, haricot verts, & mixed greens). I love the dijon balsamic vinaigrette too! Sweet, tangy, & spicy.

* Fuji Apple and Chicken Salad: Very clean tasting and light. Crisp apples, lots of chicken chunks, & a light champagne vinaigrette. Perfect on a warm day.

Food has always been consistent. Service is excellent. It's a nice place to rest after a day of shopping. The servers are always nice too...especially Arlene:)
author: Ralph N.

description:
In terms of a cafe located in a mall, this is the best experience I've had. Most notably the tomato basil soup is excellent. It is served with delicious crispy crostinis for dipping. I would also recommend the salmon asparagus angel hair pasta as well, very tasty. On top of having the best mall food, the atmosphere is pleasant enough to sit down and enjoy your lunch without crazed shoppers smacking their shopping bags into you in a crowded eating court. Lastly, the service is outstanding. You are always served with a smile, and in a timely manner. 

Bottom line: Eat here when you are in stonestown.
author: Jaime W.

description:
Clam chowder
Chicken club
Cranberry turkey

I'm very surprised by how good this was.  My cranberry turkey sandwich was really one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  Really moist, good amount of cranberry - just perfect.  The clam chowder was very good.  Rich and creamy, and just enough clamminess...

Hubby had the chicken club - looked good.  

I definitely want to go back for that turkey sandwich again.

Service... a little odd.  This was our first time here, so once we ordered, we weren't sure if we were supposed to just seat ourselves.  We didn't get a table number or anything, so how would they know who to bring the food to?  Turns out, the server will come get your receipt and then bring your food.  Our server wasn't the friendliest and didn't want to talk more than she had to, which is fine.  No smiles.  Ah well.  At least the food was good.
author: Denise M.

description:
I've been going here since I was a little kid, so this review might be biased.

Every time I go here, I get nostalgic thinking about the days when my mom would take me shopping and we'd eat here for lunch. To this day, I still think Nordstrom's cafe is a great option for delicious food at Stonestown. It's usually my go-to when I don't want to have food court food and I'm craving something healthier. Their cilantro lime chicken salad is one of my favorite salads, maybe ever. I just wish it was a little bigger! When I want something more filling, I get the chicken tomato alfredo. Honestly that could also be bigger, but maybe my stomach is just bottomless? My whole family loves the tomato soup here, and the BEST treat for kids and adults alike is the little Makers chocolates they give with the check.

They have great service, too - during my most recent trip, I found a hair in my pasta, so I sent it back. My waitress was apologetic and helpful. It may have been because they were close to closing, but they gave me 2 soups (one of each) to compensate :) The biggest downside for me is their hours - I wish they stayed open later so I could eat there more!
author: Alyssa T.

description:
I read a lot of good things about this place. I was able to stop by for lunch with a friend and I got the mushroom ravioli, whereas my friend got the tomato chicken alfredo. We also both got a cup of their basil tomato soup. Food was delicious! I would definitely come back for more.

Service is really on point here, but then because of the way they do their ordering, I'd be very upset if service wasn't as attentive as it was. So basically you come in, grab a tray like cafeteria style and order your food then pay. The waitstaff bring the food out to you and that's about it. Other than refilling your water/plantation ice tea, they just clean your table when you're done.

Decor is warm and welcoming and it's a good place to go for lunch with your friends or a business lunch as it's a little more elegant than casual dining, but not as fancy as fine dining.

They are located in both the older and newer Nordstrom in Ala Moana but the older one will be closing on March 6th 2016. They will be opening another restaurant in the new Nordstrom as well, though I forgot what the name is.
author: Alex L.

description:
I love all of the Nordstrom Cafés; this one however, is the best.  The waitstaff is very friendly and helpful.  Before I could even ask, a lady was at our table with water and breadsticks.  

I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad and a glass of Sparkling Wine.  Both were delicious.  Just enough sweetness and crispness in the salad, without being overly drenched in dressing.  So far, everything I've ever ordered here has been delicious.

The dining area is large enough to always find seating and the noise level is pleasant.  I recommend stopping here to rest your weary shopping feet, while getting a delicious bite to eat.  Now, the shopping continues...
author: Jeanie L.

description: On the bottom floor of Nordstrom's in the Stonestown Mall lies this little café with lots of options to chose from after a hard day or night of shopping. I love the salmon, it's consistently great and the tomato soup with crostini breads are delicious! Love Nordstrom's store and a long time customer. They do a great job with their cafes, too. The downtown Nordstrom Bistro in Union Square is great, too! Excellent service! Been here so many times and finally getting around to writing a review. Always a casual and friendly dining experience.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Dinner with the girlfriend. Apple and goat cheese salad. Prepared perfectly, dressed just right. The young lady had the fresh salmon pasta. Yumm what can you say besides having an idiots IPA.
author: Jesse S.

description:
A classy cafe hidden in the bottom floor of Nordstrom

Prices are a bit high but not too bad, and service is good

They have a good selection of dishes.
author: Zachary M.

description:
7/28/13 Late Lunch

I dread coming to Stonestown. Food options are bad. I'm neither a fan of food court dining nor Olive Garden. Boudin is a gluten nightmare. For a mall of decent size in the city, Stonestown really is a shame in terms of food and stores selection. 

But...

There is a gem. It's hidden on Level 1 of Nordstrom. The cafe is called such because unlike Nordstrom Bistro at Westfield SF Shopping Center, you have to order food up at the counter. They will give you a check after you pay and server will bring you the food and beverages. That works for me.

Dining room is a little dark but very clean. It reminds me of a hotel lobby. Compared to the fastfood at the food court, Nordstrom Cafe serves simple and healthier options.

*French Dip ($10.75): warm roast beef, tender and pink inside, with melted white cheddar and garlic aioli. Beef is of good quality, not dry or stringy. The baguette could be more toasty but it was warm. Served with crafted chips.

*Blue Cheese and Chicken salad ($12.75): I requested the salad sans blue cheese. This is to me the staple item at Nordstrom. Pears, candied walnuts and dried cherries are my favorite ingredients in a salad. 

The staff is efficient is very friendly. They come by and check on us. For a semi-service cafe in a casual setting, Nordstrom has rally set the bar high.
author: Matt Y.

description:
this place is still my all time favorite! I just wished they brought their famous clam chowder back to the menu for an everyday menu item. 

I usually get the sandwich, salad, soup combo. sandwich is always tuna and soup is always tomato basil with the delish crostini! yummm... if this location offered the nicoise salad like the one in palo alto, I'd def order that instead. :)

the service here is absolutely impeccable and exceptional! that's why I don't mind paying a little more for food. they sell me on their superior service every time!
author: Ann T.

description:
My mom took me here one rainy San Francisco afternoon and suggested I try their tomato soup. I'm like mom, it's a cafe in Nordstrom. She said just try it. And after I also had a huge foot in my mouth. This damn place has the best tomato soup
I have tasted so far! I'm glad my mom brought me here that one afternoon now I try to come and have some with her when I come to visit! They also have a delish chicken salad! Mmmmmm! :)
author: Miriam H.

description: Recently came here with a few friends and I have to admit I'm a huge fan of this place. I ordered the chicken cilantro salad and it was pretty good. I don't normally have any favorite salads, but this might be my favorite one! The dressing isn't too overpowering and you can taste a hint of cilantro. The portions were also pretty big. My friends ordered the Asian chicken salad and grilled cheese. Both looked pretty good but I didn't try them. The service was pretty good and our server gave us a free cookie! Overall pretty good experience and I will be returning for that salad!!
author: Kelly S.

description:
After dining here as a regular for four years, I finally had the salmon sandwich. It is tucked away on the right side of the menu. (I guess I usually only look at the left and stop as soon as I see the California Grill). The salmon sandwich was mind blowing! I totally missed out all these years. The bread is a nice fluffy and crunchy edge bread with perfectly cooked salmon for the sandwich topped with something....It was just SOO yummy! I am definitely coming back...SOON. Possibly tomorrow. 

Today was my 3rd time there this week!

The other day when I was here I was able to try the 3 Cheese Ravioli with Italian Sausage (weekly special). That was pretty good. It was a large portion. It wasn't memorable..but still delicious. (Refer to picture)

BTW Nordstrom Cafe now rotates between New England Clam Chowder (white) and Manhattan Clam Chowder (red). 
          Friday, December 2nd = Manhattan

Also, if you haven't noticed, they started using a new company for their chocolate mint sticks. I prefer the previous brand verses what they serve now. It just tastes and looks different even. I know it isn't much of a difference, but it's there. Such a bummer they switched companies. I used to have a stash of these saved in my backpack because my wonderful boyfriend always, always saved them for me. 

Also, if you noticed that they started bottling their salad dressing, the house balsamic vinaigrette is not  up for sale. They told me they haven't been able to get the recipe down for a bottle version, but if you like, you CAN call in the day before and tell them you would like to pick some up the next day and they will make extra for you. (I am not sure if they'll charge -- probably will, but it is definitely delicious.) Thus, if you ever had the balsamic vinaigrette dressing with your salad, it was made fresh that day! -- Amazing.

And one more thing -- they have WiFi now!
author: Jess W.

description:
I'm writing this review EVEN BEFORE I got my food..

I remember coming here as a kid and the dining experience here has gone downhill at a rapid pace. Maybe they can't handle the overwhelming weekend crowd, who knows? Get the right help!!

My water had an unbelievably good amount of oil on the top layer of my water. The soda I ordered was flatter than my brothers chest so I also had to send that back.

Our server was forgetful and slow. Food takes a lot longer than usual on weekends as well. 25 minutes and counting for a soup and a salad. Service alone was enough to help decide for us that this was our final visit to this place. Goodbye childhood mall cafe, it was good while it lasted. If only time didn't change the cafe experience but I must now accept the inevitable..
author: Bebe W.

description:
I ordered pasta and it was a little better than warm but I suspect it was sitting at the kitchen for a bit before it got to me.  My suspicion is reinforced by the fact that my coffee refills were slow and the honey we requested never came.  

Food is good and the place is comfy for a nice sit down eating experience.  I do like the place even though the service is inconsistent.
author: Larry L.

description:
We eat here probably at least once a month.  The long and short of it is that this place is just kid friendly and it's always easy to come here and not worry if our children are going to create a potentially embarrassing situation for us.  Of course they always do, but at least you can find solace that the staff and other patrons are more than willing to tolerate them.

Food is OK.  The menu always seems to go through some permutation and something you may have liked gets replaced.
author: Danny L.

description: Food is average and a bit expensive for a cafe. The service is really fast, restaurant is pretty big and clean. I'll probably come back if no other option in the area.
author: Melissa C.

description:
This is my long time favorite lunch spot.

It's a great place for just about any occasion and anyone. It's a nice place for a business lunch, it's also a comfortable place for a casual lunch. They are good with kids -- kids menu, crayons, kiddy cups.  You can also go there alone and not feel awkward about it. 

The staff there is friendly and the food is great. What more can you ask for?

I'm in love with their iced tea and salmon angel hair pasta. Mind you, I don't like fish but I love the salmon here. Go on Fridays, their clam chowder rocks!

I wish they stay open for dinner as well. Then it would be my favorite dinner spot as well. =)
author: Andy W.

description:
The food is really good here, but service is hit or miss. Sometimes, the workers are efficient and on top of things. At other times, service is soooo slow. Recently, it took over 30 minutes for me to get my food, which I find unacceptable. 

If you go here, come when it's not busy. The workers can't handle a crowded dining room.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Located in the bottom floor of Nordstrom lies Nordstrom Cafe.

Came to Nordstrom Cafe with a friend. This little cafe is quite cute. You order up front and take a seat and wait for your food. I ordered the California grill sammitch while my friend had a pasta dish and cheesecake.

My sammitch was surprisingly delicious! My friend and I shared the cheesecake which was also surprisingly delicious.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
This is a great spot,  I think they actually have it out front now.

But I would always get California chicken BLT. Price was higher, but the food was great and the staff was friendly.
author: Roger A.

description: Went for breakfast/lunch. This is a nice find in the stones town mall. The place is quiet and the cashier was very nice in helping us choose our meal. You order in front and they bring the food to you after you cost your own seating. I got the traditional breakfast. Eggs bacon toast. It was as expected. It included some grapes and one strawberry which I thought was pitiful. Also it had four pieces of potatoes. I wish they had included more because it was cooked quite well. My friend had the shrimp pasta. The shrimp were huge! It definitely looked good. Overall a very decent experience. They have huge cookies and muffins in the front that are reasonably priced. I will be back to try more!
author: Lisa M.

description: Always good food and great service. A little hidden but way Better then food places around the mall. I ordered the California chicken BLT. Also recommend Chinese chicken salad.
author: Carol M.

description: Servers were discriminative! I came with my two young kids, and were seated while my husband was the second in line to order. I was asked to move because the lady just finished order needed a seat. Then I was moved again the second time because the empty table was reserved but there was no sign.  I complained about it but they said they were busy and refused to find me another table.
author: Apple L.

description:
My new absolute crazy new food obsession is the salmon sandwich. Buttery brioche bun, aioli, crisped on the outside but warm and moist on the inside salmon, and a side salad. If it weren't for mercury poisoning, I would possibly eat this everyday. *drool*

Also, the staff is super friendly and gives my friend extra crostini with her tomato basil soup.
author: Natasha P.

description:
I love this Nordstrom Cafe and eat here often.  The food is always good and the service friendly and attentive.  My particular favorite is the Chicken Tomato Alfredo.  It is absolutely delicious -- penne pasta coated in a creamy tomato sauce with slivers of tender chicken and fresh spinach.  Yummmmm.  The Chinese Chicken Salad is also delicious.  It is light and filling.  The perfect dish to have on a warm day. 

I always order dessert, even when totally stuffed.  I'll take a bite or two and then box it up to take home.  The cheese cake is terrific as well as the cookies.  I don't know what coffee they brew but it is wonderful.  Much better than what is served in the coffee chains.

This cafe is the perfect spot for a nice lunch after a hard day of shopping :-)  

Oh! Almost forgot.  I'm such a fan of this cafe that I've purchased two of their cookbooks  -- "Friends and Family and "Family Table."  Both contain recipes that are easy to execute with excellent results.
author: Donna P.

description: A wonderful cafe with fantastic food and very personable servers. Love everything on the menu. My favorite is the Chinese Chicken Salad filled with organic baby greens, romaine lettuce, chicken, julienne veggies, crisp wontons, mandarin oranges, toasted almonds with ginger sesame dressing.  The manager is the best!  I've been going here for the 15 past years. My entire family loves the comfortable and cozy atmosphere.
author: Susie L.

description: I often enjoy a quick lunch here. Service is excellent and fast. And the food is great! Natural and organic ingredients. Today I enjoyed the Grilled Shrimp Arugula Salad with Sweet Corn and Warm Polenta Croutons. It was delicious! Perfectly grilled shrimp and amazing flavor combination. My mouth is watering now. Nordstrom's Marketplace Cafe is always a good choice when in the area.
author: Monique L.

description:
I used to eat at the Stanford shopping center Nordstrom cafe all the time, then they remodeled it and I never went back.

I was very happy coming here today, and it's set up as I remembered the way the Stanford one used to be.  You order and pay at the counter , then go find your own seat.

Super simple, and great wait staff that brings you your drinks and food promptly.

We had the tomato soup which is fantastic,  and the California BLT with avocado.    So good!
author: Foodlover B.

description: Always great service and food is consistently good.  I love their salads.  Parking is easy and conveniently attached to the store.  I recommend this hideaway!
author: Jan M.

description:
Food is always consistent,  excellent customer service, and a more pleasant atmosphere than the outside mall food court.  

Must order the tomato bisque soup every time!
author: Han N.

description:
I know that a lot of people get very excited about the little cafes and coffee shops in the high-end department stores. I don't... quite... get it. I mean, sure it's convenient if you're shopping there and you want to grab a quick bite, and yes it's certainly a drastic upgrade from mall food court fare. Generally they're reasonably priced, comparative to the markup on the high end cosmetics, housewares, and couture... but ultimately, the food just seems so often mediocre.

Everything I said generalizing above was true of this location. 'Nuff said.
author: Sean B.

description:
First time I heard Nordstrom having a nice restaurant, I simply laughed it off as a joke. Then I actually saw the restaurant and my mind was blown. 

Food: 
GET THE SANTA FE, we'll look at the ingredients and if sounds good to you.. GET IT! I've order it probably 20 times now. The french dip is also a good choice too, but obviously a bit more heavy. The cafe is very consistent with their food. The portions for salads and pastas are a bit too small for my taste. Even my gf who eats extremely little complains about that. 

AMBIANCE: For a restaurant inside Nordstroms, wow. It's nicely laid out with chairs, booths, etc. Waiter service is there to provide you drinks and deliver you food. You order at the front and sit down. 

SERVICE: I usually order take out, but for the times that I've eaten there, it's always been good. 

PARKING: Park on the Nordstrom side/Mcdonalds/Bank of America. There's always parking throughout the day given it's a mall. 

Overall: One of my FAVORITE grilled typed chicken sandwiches. I crave it almost weekly.
author: Austin N.

description:
Came here the other day planning on getting something to drink. I looked around for a menu and couldn't find one. I walked back out and realized they are trying to be high-class, having all the items on the menu only. 

Looking at their prices is shocking. With all the food choices in the mall, why would anyone pay this amount for what they are offering?
author: M C.

description:
The girl behind the counter who took our order was busy fanning herself and didn't seem the least bit interested in what we were saying to her. 

The server was friendly, and considering that she looked really busy, was as attentive as I think she could have been. 

The chicken on focaccia was...meh. I ate it open faced style because with both halves of the bread that was all I tasted...bread. The flavor of the sandwich filling was good but the bread seemed kind of a waste. Maybe if it had been toasted it would have been better. 

Not someplace I think I'll go again.
author: Vanessa J.

description:
This place has really gone way downhill since the change in management maybe a little over a year ago.  Not only did the prices go up, but the quality, quantity, and management overall have sunk.  I used to come here regularly for the delicious pot roast and they took it off the menu.  I was even willing to buy their cookbook if they had it in there.  They didn't.  Whatever I ordered in its place (one of the salads) was so unforgettable that I can't even remember what it was.

I asked the manager why the pot roast was taken off the menu and was told that they just decided to change the menu.  He acted concerned and offered to get it for me while I dined.  He never came back to the table so I had to approach him and ask for it.  He said that someone deleted it from the server and suggested that I write down my e-mail address so that he could send it to me.  I wrote down my phone number, address, and e-mail address so there would be no excuses not to contact me.  That's how badly I wanted it.  When I went up to give him the information, he sort of dismissed it and said to give it to my server and he'll get it from him.  Whether that happened or not, the short of it is that he never came through.

Spend your money somewhere else.  It's not what it used to be for sure.  This was a regular lunch location for our department but we'll find somewhere else.
author: Bea Q.

description: I've dined at Pleasanton and recently in San Francisco. The food was awesome.  I had angel hair pasta with chicken,  and claims.  I added shrimp,  additional cost but it was so worth it. The pasta was in a tangy/garlic sauce while the shrimp, chicken was in a red sauce. The drinks are awesome,  will sneak up on you. I had a cucumber mojhito, to die for.  I also had something that had blackberries in it OMG.  Love dinning at Nordy's. Very friendly and attentive.  We will always drop in after shopping
author: Chloe's M.

description: Just had one of the worst experiences at this restaurant. I come here all the time because I love their tomato soup and their grilled Santa fe chicken sandwich. But the minute I walked in there I had one terrible experience after another. So I come in the restaurant with my cousin after a morning at the gym and I'm standing in line looking at my phone cause the cashiers were still busy with other guests. I'm not blaming this experience on the restaurant but the lady behind me screams "NEXT!!!" in my ear to the moment where I get scared and start walking but there was no cashier to help me. I look back at her with a mean look cause she basically yelled in my ear and laughed about it and didn't even apologize. I understand that you're older than me but that gives you no right to be rude and scream in people's ears. Anyway, finally me and my cousin are next and the cashier is anything but helpful. We order the same thing with salad and they're usually supposed to ask what kind of dressing we want and the cashier assumed we wanted the same dressing. So we tried to explain it to the cashier and she said "your server will get that for you" and my cousin was thirsty so she was trying to ask for a cup of water and the cashier kept saying "your server will get that for you". So we sit at our table and I'm already in a bad mood because I just got yelled at for no reason and we waited for our server to the point where my cousin got up to get some water. Our server apologized and said "oh I'm sorry I could have gotten that for you in seconds". So we ate our food which was good up until the end where I'm just a few sips from finishing my water and I notice a FLY in the lemon. So at this point Im disgusted and I let my server know. Usually when there's a bug in anyone's food or drink the meal should be compensated. But he talked to the manager and just said I was going to get a free dessert. I just burst out crying because I was already having a terrible day and I had just came from the gym and dessert is not going to help my situation of having a healthier lifestyle. I just took the dessert so I could give it to my daughter. I used to love going here up until this experience. I guess you could come here if you like flies in your drink.
author: Gladys R.

description:
Came here for lunch.

1. Tomato Basil Soup: Ohmydilemmaoftomatobeingfruitorvegetable. This was amazing. A have-to order when coming here.

2. Corn Chowder: This was the soup of the day; it was also pretty good, but pales in comparison to the Tomato Basil, maybe that's why the choices are: Soup of the day or Tomato Basil.

3. Side Salad: ordinary side salad, nothing special. The ceasar dressing was good, Ginger sesame dressing was very strong. bleh.

4. Tuna Sandwich: only took a bite, but was 3/5, nothing special.

5. Santa Fe Chicken Sandwich: It was tasty, the bread was very unique. But VERY VERY oily.
author: Gary W.

description:
I came here today to have some lunch before going into work. Sitting alone on my table, having no one to converse with left me enjoying the ambiance of the cafe. Subtle smooth jazz playing in the background, left and right people enjoying their meals with great company, the children were busy doodling with the crayons they were gifted and gnawing on their grilled cheese sandwiches, and I am not just talking about the temperature when I say this, but I adored the warmth of the room.

Today I had the Tomato Basil Soup, which I didn't have in more than 2 years. Almost immediately after I gulped my first warm spoonful, I wanted to slap myself for depriving myself of such decadence! OH MAN, its THAT good. I love the comforting feeling I get when I eat this soup. Hmmmm... Aside from the the soup, I also had the California Grill Sandwich which had roasted Havarti turkey, crispy delicious bacon, tomatoes, lettuce, garlic aioli, avocado and I opt'd out the cheese (not because it doesn't go well together, I just don't like cheese) Along side a salad with balsamic vinaigrette! Awesome! I am passionately in love with the option of either having chips or salad when ordering any sandwich. Normally in other places you pay for that side, not here!

In the past I have had other items on their menu and I have been more than satisfied with them all! And costumer service has always been superb!  Definitely would recommend this place to anyone! Welcomes those who are eating alone, have company or with 16 kids! (They are really child friendly they have a children's menu!)
author: Fran M.

description:
They have free wifi -- all throughout Nordstroms.  

TIP: for strongest signal, sit closer to the entrance of the cafe.

Nordstrom = great customer service, and that goes for the cafe too.

What my wife and I have enjoyed here and recommend:
Bowtie Pasta
Turkey BLT
Rosemary Focaccia sandwich
Chocolate chip cookies are awesome

Meh:
Cilantro lime chicken salad
Tiramisu
author: George K.

description:
[M]ona: 3 Stars
[W]ayne: 3.5 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars

+ Good Service
+ Spacious
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Yummy Tomato Bisque

- No reception
- Dark
 
[W] Everytime I come here, there's nothing in particular I don't like. I usually order the tomato basil pasta but today we tried out the California Grill Sandwich and the bowl of Tomato Bisque. The sandwich comes with a choice of chips or salad....and knowing me, OF COURSE THE CHIPS haha. They were out of Eggy Bread for the California Grill, so we had to go with Wheat. We didn't enjoy it so much... bleh. The Tomato Bisque comes with a little piece of bread for dip. 
 
Nordstrom Cafe is on the lower level of the store. So if you're hungry while shopping, it's one of the better alternatives other than the regular mall food court stuff. Just remember that if you need to make calls, there's no reception down there! Service is normally very nice as well. You just seat yourself and the waiter/waitress comes and takes your receipt to go get your food. At the end of your meal, you get a nice little stick of chocolate mint also which tastes like Andes. No complaints from me.
author: Mona C.

description: Best cookie ever is the casino royale. It's chocolate chip, shredded coconut, and macadamia nut.  They always run out.  Great with a cup of coffee.
author: Shirley N.

description: This place is amazing. The service, food, and setting is all fabulous, and that's really all to be said. No one I've ever gone with has not loved their food.
author: Emma N.

description:
Silent treatment.

Downstairs at their Stonestown location you'll find a cafe. Inside the cafe are chocolate chip cookies. And inside the cookies are lots and lots of massive chocolate chips.

One of those cookies you take a bite of and want to tell the world how good it is. And then realize you don't want to share. So you say nothing.

Was silent the whole ride home.
author: Jason B.

description: Convenient cafeteria-style restaurant serving reliable, good food. French dip roast beef sandwich was perfect-tender thin slices of medium roast beef on soft toasted roll with homemade au jus. Tomato soup with crostini was delicious. Add some Parmesan cheese to the soup-yum.
author: Debbie N.

description: I didn't realize this cafe was so big! I tried the Santa Fe chicken sandwich ( sliced chicken breast, roasted red peppers, onions, avocado, chipotle aoli on grilled sourdough.) it comes with your choice of salad or chips. I got a Caesar salad. The sandwich was delish, fresh and had tons of flavor. The salad was really good and had home made croutons. The service was perfect, very attentive and friendly. I saw there were some regulars who the servers knew and were great with ( lots of elderly folks). They offer fresh cracked black pepper for your salad, and bread and butter before your meal. They  give a nice chocolate stick with your check. You order and pay at the register, but they still give you another check when you're done. I guess you can add on to your order as you're eating. Great location, lots of space, clean, great food, great service. I'll definitely be back to try their other food!
author: Cyn L.

description:
The best dining option at Stonestown Galleria!

Salmon Pasta is my favorite. Delicious! All the sandwhiches are great too!  I've never had bad service here...yet.. lol

I will be back soon.
author: Andrew V.

description: After waiting for over 20 minutes for a grilled cheese sandwich and a tomato soup to arrive... What the hell... I found paper in my tomato soup. When I complained to the server, she promptly took my soup away and handed me a new bowl of the same soup (probably made from the same batch). Needless to say, I left without eating and was very disappointed with the service. I will not be back. NO NO NOrdstrom cafe, I will stay away!
author: Maria C.

description:
This place is definitely a personal favorite. 
I used to live right behind this place so you could find me here quite often and I was always super excited for it. 
Their food is absolutely AMAZING. Seriously, I've had almost everything on the menu and my tastebuds have been absolutely satisfied every single time. 
If you have a sweet tooth, you MUST and I mean MUST get a chocolate chip cookie and ask them to warm it up. It's seriously one of the best chocolate chip cookies ever and I LOVE chocolate chip cookies. 

The staff is also quite accommodating and they are super super sweet. I always leave a pretty decent tip. 

Enjoy!
author: Julia L.

description:
I come here when I want a pleasant, quiet lunch.
They have great dishes for the price. I love the half sandwich, soup and small salad. 
They have pastas, sandwiches, soups, and salads.
When ever I come here, I don't know if it's because of the time or what but it's always pretty empty and quiet. Their are a lot of elderly people here, it looks like they like to come hangout here for lunch, so cute.
Overall, good place for lunch, conveniently placed and quick service.
author: francis c.

description:
Wow, this place is yummy! I recently went with my mom for lunch. Super easy to order, pick a seat, and wait a couple minutes for your food. The staff is very friendly, and we both really enjoyed our food. I ordered a chicken sandwich, but it wasn't any ordinary chicken sandwich, it was very elevated for cafe food! Juicy and flavorful. it came with a side, and I picked a house salad, which hit the spot. 

If you are looking for a yummy, quick, healthy bite at the mall, look no further!
author: Becca D.

description:
One Saturday morning...I was craving a salad badly.

I was thinking Foccacia downtown, but I was too lazy to drive down there. Some how I end up heading to Stonestown & went to Nordstrom Cafe.

Their food is great...it would be a 5-Star if the price was a tad lower. But you pay for very very great courtesy & cleansiness!!

They even include a chocolate at the end of the meal.

California Grill - Roasted Turkey, Tomato, Bacon, Swiss Cheese, Avocado, Garlic Aioli on Grilled Sourdough Bread w/ Green Salad
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/pvyY6CBw3C4FpiOqzIjJbw/l

Half Sandwich, Salad & Soup - Half Tuna Salad Sandwich, Organic Baby Green Salad, Choice Of Dressing, Soup & Parmesan Crostini
http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/3dw4ZG9mq32kkeAT3faFwg/l

(Saturday, August 29, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description:
The sandwich I had here was so yummy.

It was my first time here, so I was a bit confused at first with the way things worked. You line up near the menu table for one of the cash registers to open up. One of the workers at the cash register will take your order and you pay and they hand you your receipt. You sit anywhere you like and a waiter/waitress will come by and grab your receipt from you.

We probably waited 10 minutes until our orders finally came out. I didn't mind because my friend and I were busy catching up.

I ordered the Rosemary Chicken Focaccia Sandwich and it was so good! Each sandwich comes with a side salad with your choice of dressing. I think I will get this sandwich again the next time I come. Salad was average with some fresh grape tomatoes. The ranch dressing I got went well with the salad.

I was pretty pleased with our waiter. He served us water and placed our utensils and napkins neatly onto our table. He checked in on us once before he handed us back our receipts and gave us some mint chocolates to sample. I'm sure the other waiters/waitresses are just as good.

I will definitely return here again the next time I get hungry while shopping at Stonestown! It's a great place to sit back and relax.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Maybe I should have expected the prices to be what they were, given that it was a Nordstrom Cafe, and truth be told the sandwiches weren't really what I would consider overpriced. But, that's only because they were really, surprisingly good. I ordered the Santa Fe Chicken Sandwich - chicken, cheese, avocado on sourdough bread (that I'm pretty sure had been toasted in parmesan cheese, mmmm).

The only thing that really annoyed me about the cafe was that you have to pay up front, but then get semi-waiter service at the table. So this means that we were unsure whether to tip, and because there's no "tip line" on the receipt (and you'd have to do it up front) you pretty much HAVE to have cash in order to tip. It was just kind of odd, and I think it would make more sense if you paid afterward so you can properly tip and etc. But it's just a small quibble.

Overall it wasn't quite as cheap a dining experience as I would have preferred for somewhere with little to no atmosphere, but on the other hand it was a surprisingly nice place for just being in a mall.
author: Amanda P.

description: The tomato soup is a must and the sandwiches are really good too. Had an incident with one rude server, but the rest have all been so sweet. Perfect place to get food with a friend, wish the decor was a little better. Will definately be back.
author: Laurel R.

description:
Not worth a journey or even a detour, but definitely worth a visit.  The food is nothing to write home about, but it's solid and tasty -- and comforting.  If your nerves have been frazzled by a long session of frantic shopping, I can guarantee that you'll feel better after a meal or a snack at this Cafe.

I came for lunch with two colleagues.  Ordering at the counter was quick and easy; we sat down to await our lunches.  Drinks came almost immediately, and our soups arrived soon after.  Our main courses (including a salad for me) were brought out exactly when we wanted them, and our glasses were refilled periodically.  In fact, the service was really excellent, which is far from what you expect at a place where you order as you enter and sit down with your number engraved on a plastic tent.

The main thing is that the food, decor and service combine to make this restaurant soothing.  As I said, it's a great place to stop off if you're shopping.  It's also a good choice if you're on the SF State campus and don't mind walking a block or two for your lunch.
author: Kenneth R.

description: Nordstrom Cafe is a great place to go if you want a soup and sandwich, or both if your willing to pay the $20. I know the menu has other options like pasta but the sandwiches are way too good to pass up! The tomato soup with herb and cheese covered crustinis  on the side is extremely satisfying for creamy tomato soup lovers. However, the servers are stingy about bringing extras to you for free (or even if you pay for extra when you order) it's kinda funny. My friends and I joke about it constantly since a waiter told us were "maxed out" hahaha. They're just too good.
author: Katey G.

description:
I've been coming here with my parents since I was a toddler. I've pretty much grown up going to Stonestown, so naturally, the Nordstrom Cafe is very familiar to me. Despite the older crowd (and by older I mean 50+ years), you'll see lots of young kids and familes. No surprise there, the cafe is right in the middle of the kiddie clothes/shoe floor.

1. Grab a menu
2. Order up at the counter
3. They give you a receipt
4. Go find a table/sit where you like. leave the receipt out.
5. Waiter comes by and looks at your receipt
6. Brings your drinks
7. Brings your food.
8. Eat!!
9. Leave tip and continue shopping :)

The food is great cafe food!! Great sandwiches, soups, salads, and a kids menu including mac n cheese,grilled cheese, tomato soup, and fruit.  Today I had the California Grill and enjoyed the warm buttery toasted sourdough bread, crispy bacon, slices of avocado, turkey, all held together by the oozing melting cheese. The mixed green salad includes cuts of cherry tomatoes and a tangy sweet dressing. 

But i'm giving it 3 stars because we always have LOUSY SERVICE.  Today we asked for 2 cups of water and 1 coffee. The waitress came back with the coffee, cream, but no spoon!  How are we supposed to stir the cream and sugar in? We had to opt for the knife. But now we have a coffee covered knife :( And she only gave us 1 cup of water. Then we waited around forever for her to come by again to refill the coffee. And we got tired of waiting for the check so we just left the minimum tip and went on our way. I'm sad about having to leave before  we got our check.. My favorite part of the nordstrom cafe has always been the chocolate mint sticks they give you with your receipt!

Sandwich + coffee = $11.99 (not including tip)
author: Samantha L.

description: This place is ridiculously slow, and an embarrassment to Nordstrom standards of service. Despite there being 10 waitstaff keeping themselves busy behind the counter and only a handful of customers, you can regularly expect to wait a half an hour for food. That's when it's slow. When it's lunch rush, forget about it. The food is really good though, better than you expect.
author: Laetitia S.

description: For some reason I like coming here for a quick meal.  Service is always great, food tasty and atmosphere kinda geriatric...hahaha.  Their clam chowder is good, California grill sandwich great, salads excellent, with uber convenient parking.
author: Joel M.

description:
When the world is treating you wrong, Nordies Cafe really knows how to treat you right.

They serve comfy cafeteria food with a little Nordies' flare in a pretty cozy place where you sit back and rest for a minute.
I usually get the California Grill.  The combination of hot turkey, cool avocado, and melting jack all between in a nicely grilled and slightly greasy (in a good way) sourdough bread can be very filling and satisfying.

What impresses me is the service.  Besides bringing the food to your table and checking to see if you need anything, the staff is genuinely friendly.  I dare say it rivals some of the nicer sit down places I frequented and is totally unexpected to find this kind of attention in a cafe setting.
But it is Nordstrom so that just maybe the norm.

Overall, you get some good food in a comfortable and relaxed setting.
author: Dan B.

description:
Nordstrom Cafe, how I love thee. I've been coming here for a year since I worked at the mall. Jacqui recommended the mac 'n cheese and the grilled cheese with tomato basil soup combo and I've been in love ever since. Yeah, they're off the kids' menu, but the employees who take our order never give us funny looks. The portion is just enough to keep you moving for the rest of that 8 hour shift, and it's perfect if you don't wanna eat too much. It comes with a drink and refills are free?!?! Yup. On the days where I came alone, I'd just put in my iPhone earbuds and shut myself off from the world while enjoying soup during my half hour lunch break. Heaven is silence and yummy food, I guarantee it. $5 for a grilled cheese sandwich, soup, drink, and fruit? Sign me up!

Arlene is such a darling! She knows that I like bringing a refill back to work so she brings it over without asking, along with the Ovation mints. ;)

Recommendations:
1. California Grill sandwich
2. Steak Ciabatta sandwich
3. Avoid long lines during the weekday lunch hours! There is literally an army of elderly ladies who fill up the Cafe.
4. Tomato Basil soup
5. You can order HALF a sandwich, and it'll still come with salad.
author: Olivia V.

description: Amazing food as always! Arlene was my sever and I have never had such outstanding service here before. :) so sweet, attentive and prompt.
author: Jillian C.

description: We stopped to eat after squeezing in some last minute shopping on 8/17/13. The cashier really needs to be retrained or reassigned. You don't want to start your somewhat, upscale cafeteria-style dining experience this way. We don't expect much when we come here to eat, but it's more relaxing than the mob in the mall food court. Just wish the staff was happier.
author: Nansee P.

description:
My ode to Angel Hair with Salmon and Asparagus:

And I get the same thing every single time
Cuz it's the, it's the best, it's the, it's the best
it's the, it's the best, it's the, it's the best
It's the best i ever had, best i ever had, best i ever had, best i ever had
author: april p.

description: The food isn't do bad. It was actually better then I expected. I enjoy coming here after shopping around and want to grab something to eat but not from the food court with all the craziness.
author: Scarlett F.

description:
Nordstrom Cafe is my go to place if I don't want to deal with the long lines and teeny boppers at the food court. 
Services is fast and friendly. You order and pay for your food at the register and sit wherever you'd like. Server comes out with your food/drinks and you're all set.
My usuals are:
~Salmon Caesar Salad
~Mixed Berry Salad
~Angel Hair Pasta w/ Salmon
~Chicken Tomato Alfredo
~Tomato Bisque Soup w/ Grilled Cheese Sandwich
~Macaroni & Cheese (for my daughter)

Nice and quiet place to go and grab a bite.
author: Anna P.

description: I started coming here a couple of years ago as a meeting and dining place w two former colleagues.  I was pleasantly surprised w the delicious apple, chicken, goat cheese salad and yummy tomato soup.  Also, we were not rushed out and spent a considerable amount of time chatting.  My friends ordered sandwiches and all were good.  It has been our go to meeting place now and have been back several times.  On occasion we have shared a dessert. My 20 year old daughter agreed to go w me while shopping and has ordered the pasta.  Also very good.  The past two times I was there w my daughter service was very slow.  Last time we shared pizza and waited about a half hour.  The waiter apologized and gave us each a free dessert of our choice...creme brûlée.  This is the best place to eat while shopping at Stonestown.  Also you pay at the counter when you order your food so don't have to deal w splitting the bill when w friends.
author: H. D.

description:
Of course this place is pricey for a cafe. It's Nordstroms. I always get the grilled cheese and tomato basil soup, yes from the kid's menu but very filling. I've tried their tuna melt and its tasty as well. Red velvet is my favorite cake so wherever I see it, I snag a piece. And to my amazement, Nordstroms had red velvet so I bought a slice and was very surprised because it was very good. It was nice and moist. The servers here are very friendly so I make sure if I'm dining in, I leave them a nice tip. 

On one note, this place has a distinct smell. Not too be rude or disrespectful but from looking around you can tell why this place has that smell.
author: Dara S.

description:
Why have I not written a review about this place?  My friend and I come here very often and this is pretty much our go-to place if we are craving something semi-unhealthy.  WE LOVE THIS PLACE....LOOOOVE this place for its California grill (leave the bacon on the side or take it out, please).  Super tasty and it comes with fries or a salad.  We usually opt for a salad--hence, the prefix..."semi."

Prices are also not bad and fairly affordable.  I mean seriously, Nordstrom carries some high end brands that will cost you an arm and a leg.  (I'm a victim ....sweaters for $58, yeah let's not go there).  So when I say affordable, the food is definitely affordable =)

Beware though, this place gets rather busy on weekends during lunchtime but the cafe employees are fast and also very very friendly.  Then again, Nordstrom is all about customer service...I think that is another reason why we continue to keep coming back.
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
Bring back the chicken gnocchis!  They are to die for. 

 I just had the creamy chicken avocado soup. It was so rich and delicious and the crostini is crispy, tasty and addictive. 

They also added a few cupcakes to the dessert menu and  I must say, I am a fan.
author: Liza B.

description: I love this place, I really do. I eat here at least three times a week. The Chinese chicken salad is to die for. The servers though, particularly the Asian women are so freakin rude. They literally make me not want to come here. Like there's plenty of other people who would love to take your job. Be happy geez.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Not sure why but I love Nordy cafe.Their sandwiches and tomato soup are delicious. And in the morning before a shopping trip or after a gym workout their breakast isn't too bad either. 
My kids love it and it reminds me of cutting high school and taking coffee and tea breaks on shopping trips with Grandma.
author: Ro M.

description: We've been going to this place for almost 15 years. The food is excellent. We modify most of our orders because we are vegetarians and they never complain. Servers are excellent, courteous and friendly.
author: Teckles B.

description: I love it here! I love their salads, especially the mixed berry one. I usually order their tomato alfred pasta because it just tastes so darn good. Not much to say about here but their service is sometimes slow which gives them one less star. Also they aren't as attentive to refill your water or whatnot, but I do like their food and come here quite often when I shop at Stonestown.
author: Amanda C.

description: The food here is generally good, and above average for Stonestown. The pasta dishes are generally quite good, though serving sizes are modest (but fitting given the modest prices). Service is slow, but friendly. Above all, the Cafe offers a quiet and pleasant break from the mall.
author: Chris T.

description:
Recommends: 
California Grill 
Roast Beef with Au Jus
Tuna Sandwich

Nordstrom cafe is one of our "default" and quick foods to get at the mall.  Though, most of the food in the menu stays the same, our usual never seems to fail us.  

Props to the Stonestown Cafe staff for being so friendly and accommodating.
author: Ellaine P.

description: I used to work here back when I was fresh out of culinary school and trying to make a name for myself.  Since this is Stonestown, it's kind of hard to hate on this place considering this the best place for food in the mall.  They do have something for everyone but my favorite sandwich is still the Santa Fe.
author: A L.

description: i love it here, the food is good and the portions are decent not too bad and not too small. i actually finish my meal here. you mainly line up order your food and get a table.  however, i wish the menu had more selections.  i usually get the gnocchi here or the angel hair pasta with salmon. i love the dream sauce they used.. it's not too heavy and it wasn't too salty. I love the bread/cheese sticks they serve to you before the meal comes out. the service is always good here, everyone is very friendly.
author: Belinda C.

description: nordstrom king pin..always here buying what i don't need haha..
author: Jhermaine S.

description: My favorite place for lunch. Always fresh, always tasty. Try their daily soups.  This place is nice and easy!
author: Doug M.

description: Surprisingly decent for mall food. Good portions for the price. Usually great service except when particularly busy or when you're being served by one particular individual. When I see her, I know I'm getting bad service.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Classy, cozy with a price tag to match all within the comfort of the Stonestown mall. But it IS Nordstrom so you know better than to think they'd settle for less than 5 star restaurant quality. My chicken and artichoke heart salad was huge, fresh and really satisfied my craving. Of course you can go right over to Trader Joes and pick up an equally tasty, high quality salad, but you go to the Cafe for the ambiance, darling. And why not? Its got romantic low-lighting, lots of tables, great service and why not grab of slice of their many enticing cakes? Or maybe have one of their gigantic cookies to go with that salad. 

Perfect place to meet someone for lunch or to make a dinner date or even to munch alone and treat yourself.
author: Emiko T.

description:
A cozy, quiet getaway from the hustle and bustle of the mall. As many have mentioned, their tomato basil soup is delish. My sister always gets the tuna salad sandwich, which is solid as well. 

*tip: I WOULDN'T recommend the garlic potato soup--as good as it sounds, it's mostly broth and contains no potato pieces! bust
author: Diane G.

description:
If you're super hungry, I suggest not going here for lunch on a Saturday. My friend and I got there around noon and had to stand in line for 25-30 minutes. It was super packed! We placed our order and had to wake a little longer for a table.

As soon as we got seated, our waitress brought my friend and I water. It took a little while for our food to come though. We both ordered the angel hair pasta w/ asparagus and salmon. It was pretty good. I'm a huge fan of salmon and asparagus so it hit the spot for me.

We also ordered a citrus salmon Caesar salad to share. Salmon overload I know, but the food was all good.

It was my first time eating at Nordstrom Cafe and aside from the wait, it was a good first experience :).
author: Justine O.

description:
Okay before I get "hated" on just bare with me on this review.

My overall review of Stonestown was and still is a sold 1 star. Feel free to read that review BTW.

Obviously this review is just for the Nordstrom Cafe.  Granted I was boozing pretty heavily with some alumni and recent graduates the night before and perhaps my taste buds were shot but I absolutely love this place.  *(pending a second and sober review)

I figure there's absolutely nothing Stonestown has to offer.  Their food court sucks.  Then I was introduced to this cafe by my lovely lunch date.  I dont like all the noise. I want to enjoy a conversation in a slow place environment. I had originally planned on taking her to Spire but I was running late and she was at Stonestown so I met her there... reluctantly.

What a surprise!!  Its located on the lower level and away from all the hustle and bustle of last minute Christmas shoppers.  The staff were super friendly and very professional.  They offered suggestions which I took and it was a good one.  You order at the front and they bring the food to you. Jason B. was right about the turkey and cranberry sandwich.  My lunch date ordered it and it also came with a side salad.  I ordered the gnocchi with chicken and mushrooms.  2 teas which were surprisingly good and I'm not a tea drinker.  We shared everything. 

You're offered chocolate mints after the meal but we never received any.  My friend knew they forgot so she went up to the counter and grabbed a few.  *awesome* I'm not docking any stars for this little hiccup.

After all said and done the bill was $23 fore real food.
author: Sun T.

description:
Nordstrom Cafe left a lot to be desired in the service department.  They were impatient when taking our orders.  They laughed at my Mom's jokes (but tiredly, it was the end of the day).  They gave us the minimal service to keep a reviewer at 3 stars.

However, the food I ordered was delicious.  I had the Citrus Salmon Caesar Salad.  The salad was fresh, the dressing delicious, the croutons crunchy and the Parmesan cheesy.  And to top it all off was a huge salmon fillet that flaked well and tasted like a citrus-y born-again fish.  The only downside to mine was that the serving was small!  Whoever heard of cutting back on lettuce to make the main part (the salmon) more desirable?

My brothers' tomato pasta alfredo, though good, was nothing to write home about.  The chicken was tough and unpalatable.  I think if it were perhaps the peak of tomato season the sauce would be much more appealing and would cover up the chicken's grotesque toughness.

I appreciated the quiet, yet outdated modern, atmosphere the cafe provided an hour before closing.  Made for wonderful conversation.

All in all I thought the prices a bit high for a mall cafe ($11 for a SALAD) but I enjoyed the privacy of our table and the savory flavour of the food, no matter how small.

I'll be back.... if someone else pays ;)
author: Kimiko Q.

description: One of the best tuna sandwiches in the city. The bread is perfectly toasted and the fish does not have an overpowering fishy smell. Relatively cheap as well.
author: Gilbert L.

description: I'm a fan of the kids menu here. Especially the grilled cheese and tomatoes soup meal!  Its always crowded when I come so there is a bit of a wait. Haven't tried anything from the grown up menu..
author: Siai M.

description: In general I really like the food here and service has been okay. I love the tomato basil soup and crostini. The service, however, can be spotty. Maybe I am just grumpy but I don't think it should take 30 minutes for a sandwich.Yesterday I ordered a grilled Tuscan chicken pesto sandwich, by the time I got it, it was cold and soggy. The worst was when it took over 45 minutes to get a 1/2 sandwich and cup of soup. Every 10 minutes or so, the server would come by and say "it's coming!" All the other people around me that came in after me had already finished eating. Trust me, I am not a difficult customer by any stretch of the imagination and I tip well. Fortunately, this seems to be more the exception than the rule.
author: Denise B.

description:
I love this little cafe on the bottom floor at the Stonestown store.  They make a tomato basil soup that comes with a couple of slices of grilled french bread with cheese.  One of the best tomato soups I have ever had, and it's always on the menu.  Yesterday I wanted to try a sandwich and was absolutely delighted with the California Grill on sourdough bread.  It comes with sliced turkey (very fresh), avocado, tomato and bacon on nicely grilled bread.

The combo was perfect!!  I did the half sandwich and half soup, had to pay a bit extra because it is normally a tuna sandwich,  but was very happy and perfect for me.  They also give you a choice of salad or chips, no fries, which is my only complaint.  Maybe they do, but didn't ask.

They are never crowded and the service is excellent!!!  A little hidden secret, no noisy mall, no looking around for a place to sit.  Nice comfortable booths and you feel like you are in a regular restaurant as opposed to in a major mall.
author: Roberta W.

description: This place does not do substitutions well!! Just went back and ordered the same salad to-go - no croutons, dressing on the side. Got back to the office and my salad portion had been halved and did not include any dressing at tall. Such a disappointment for the price and wait.
author: Briana G.

description: Nordie's Cafe Stonestown I'm sucha fan. When i used to work here this was a spot to get lunch and it still is! They have great pastas, sandwiches and salads. You can't go wrong with the half sandwich half salad. Staff is very courteous. This is a great place to relax after shopping.
author: Marie P.

description:
I have been coming here for years and I love it, i have never had a disappointing time. 

The food is always good and it fills you up, they use good quality food. I always get the salads and they never disappoint me.

The prices are a bit on the expensive side but that is okay since the food is so good.

I recommend this place to anyone who is at Stonestown and doesn't want to eat mall food.
author: Alicja D.

description: Their Chai Tea Lattes are delicious! They offer two different flavors: Spiced or Vanilla. Both flavors taste so good! I've recently found out what type of Chai Tea mix they use and I'm excited to purchase them so I can start making my own.
author: Christine E.

description:
The California Grill is still one of my faves. But I've found a new favorite- the Chicken, Goat Cheese and Apple Salad (or something like that). It was perfection!!!! It was all good - especially the dressing! 

The lines get pretty ridiculous especially at lunch so I would recommend doing what I normally do if you're doing take out. Yesterday the line was about 12 people long so I peeked at the menu walked ten feet from the line by the escalator, called from my cell and placed my order. After browsing through the clothes for ten minutes I walked right in and past the line to pick up my order! : )
author: Valerie A.

description:
I'm really tempted to give them a five because I really like their service.  My favorite at that place, besides their clam chowder, is the chicken salad with goat cheese.  Considering they use chicken breast rather than thighs, I thought the meat was as rather moist, dressing amount modest but appropriate, ingredients tasted fresh.  

But to top everything off, I thought the customer service was great!  Our server was attentive to our needs.  Even though I know all their customers would get a business card with a "Thank You" note on it, it's that kind of gentle touch on customer service that really attracts customers back.  I know I will be one of many.
author: Helen C.

description: This place is yummy ! I always order the grilled salmon lemon caesar salad and their clam chowder. I loveeee their clam chowder and it's one of the best that I've tried. The bad thing is that they don't always have the soup it's every other friday. The service here is good and the quality of food is there as well.  Really nice place to have lunch with a friend and just chat. Beware that during lunch time they get really busy and the line can be long especially on Fridays.
author: Lucy C.

description:
After deliberating on several eating choices, we went to the Nordstrom Cafe today before heading out for some shopping. And if we knew what we know now after our ordeal. We would've bypassed this POORLY RUN establishment.----bad kitchen process (Where is Chef Gordon Ramsay to put these imbeciles in their place?), lackadaisical wait staff and bad FOH line management.
