Our order was a simple sandwich that took over 35 minutes to prepare and get served-----the waitress seemed disinterested in letting us know what was going on until she felt it would be a good idea to save her tip by saying the order is on its way....strangely enough a table that just sat down were already eating their sandwich orders before us. 

Blame definitely rests on both the waitress who was so attentive on helping fill beverage orders for other patrons and the kitchen/line manager...how hard is it to prepare a simple sandwich order without any special requests? 

Very poor kitchen management skills by the kitchen (I would not call any of these poorly trained staffers as a "COOK") ---how are the orders being called out? Telepathy or pony-express?

I would avoid this place like a plague. You are better off going to 7-11 for their hot dogs.
author: Jessie M.

description:
The perfect compliment to a day of shopping!
Not only is the service fast and friendly, it is also very accomodating!
One time they took the chicken out of the "chicken tomato alfredo pasta" for me.
Also the food is pretty darn tasty, not five star cuisine but deffinitely enough to hold you over in a mall, and far better than the food court selections.
Four stars because on some occassions they bring over some slices of bread, and on others they dont. Not too sound too demanding, but a little consistency would be nice. 
Also, you have to go out of your way to get a refill for your drink, and sometimes the place is a tad crowded for a weekday afternoon, 
but whose complaining? not me!
author: Mercedez P.

description: Good for breakfast, lunch. Their tomato soup is really good. I have no complaints about their menu, the staff is really friendly the cafe is clean. Can't go wrong with eating here.
author: Irma R.

description: Tomato soup + Grilled cheese = wow. The tomato soup is too good and I just found out you can buy em and make em yourself. I am about to buy boxes of them next time I go to san fran. their service is good too, Love the filipina ladies, they are very attentive and nice. and that mint chocolate straw thing u get in the end is worth it !! Love those things.
author: Floyd H.

description: Ordered the prosciutto and arugula pizza and my sister ordered the shrimp and angel hair pasta. Both were delicious and the server was very attentive. I miss the pot roast noddles which was part of their menu last year. Good service and good food.
author: Colleen Y.

description:
This is the best cafe that nordstrom has ever had, EVER!

First off, they have the best booths so you can always sit pretty feeling like you are VIP. 

Second, the waiters and waitresses are totally on it, refilling your drinks, making sure your bread basket is never empty and bringing your food in a timely manner. They even ask if you want dessert, which I only order if the waiter/ress asks me. 

Third, they have the best menu. Hellooo? Lobster Bisque? you cannot even compete with that so don't even try. 

Everyone here is super friendly and awesome and I will trek all the way there just to have the best nordies cafe experience possible.
author: Sarah S.

description: This is our go-to spot for weekend lunch.  The Tomato soup is the best I've ever had.  The sandwiches are amazing.  The service is excellent and fast.  I love this place.
author: Jeffrey G.

description: Clean, polite and attentive staff.  I enjoyed my salad, my 16 month olds enjoyed his cheese crackers and fruit. My 11year old enjoyed her soup and half of sandwich.
author: Chante C.

description:
THERE WAS A BUG CRAWLING ON MY FRIEND'S PLATE!!
I wish I could give Nordstrom Cafe 5 stars but after what happen recently I don't know if I'll be back.  

My friend and I went to have lunch and towards the end of our lunch she noticed a bug crawling on her plate. The bug crawled around for awhile all over her sand which and Kettle chips. We could barely get the attention from any of the waiters so I hunted someone down and told him. He came over to the table and said "Well what do you want me to do? Do you want more chips or something" LOL

"What do you want me to do?" Is he serious right now?! How about you give her a new plate or something. The waiter was an idiot and I expect more from a place like that. We were so annoyed and to top it off our waiter never came by to check on us or refill our water. 

The food is good but if you find a bug in it, don't expect them to care.....
author: Shamiya M.

description:
When you go to the mall, you usually find fast food, like the stuff at the food courts, or burger joints.  It's really nice to find a nice, sit-down place with gourmet cuisine, that's fast, convenient, and at an affordable price.  Nordstrom's Cafe offers all the those conveniences, complete with full and fast service.  The one in Stonestown is generally the eatery I prefer when I'm meeting at that mall with friends or shopping.

Last time I was there with my boyfriend, we both started off with the soup of the day (for Saturday) - Baked Potato.  It came with a parmesan crostini that tasted just right when dipped in the creamy and savory soup.  He ordered the French Dip Sandwich with a salad with balsamic vinigarette.  The dipping sauce was just right.  I, of course, ordered my favorite - Chicken and Wild Mushroom Gnocchi.  If you've never tried gnocchi before, or even if you have, trust me - you'll fall in love with this one.  The sauce, the dumplings, and the veggies just go together so well.  

The cafe has lots of different desserts to choose from - from mixed fruit bowls, to a decadent chocolate turtle cake...but we chose a slice of red velvet that day.  Although it was just a tad bit dry...still I can say:  YUM!  The cream cheese frosting frosting wasn't too overpowering or too rich, and of course, red velvet cake is all together delicious in itself.

The food is great, and the service is always wonderful.  Everyone is always in a pleasurable disposition, and never lets your water glass go empty.  Our server that day was Natasha, and she was so nice...she was very friendly.  

So, if you're at Stonestown, stop by and you'll see what I mean when I say this place is great...
author: Maria-Zenaida M.

description: So I used to frequent this place when I was in high school because they had this amazing steak sandwich! Like super amazing! But i went back recently to find that they have not served that sandwich for awhile now! I ordered a half sandwich/half soup order instead and it was alright, but nothing as spectacular as that steak sandwich! Everything was fine but I just can't go back there knowing they don't have that sandwich!
author: Wilson T.

description:
Rare gem in Stonestown mall, away from the
bustling, teeny-bopping food court.  A solid 5 star cafeteria
on the first level of Nordstrom.

Great lunch date spot or a meeting with a new client. Or a
rest stop after you shopped.  You deserve it!

Since it is a cafeteria, you first order your food and then pay in line.
You get to choose your own seating, instead of being directed.

My favorites are the Tomato Basil Soup / California Grill Sandwich combo;
Tuna Salad /Steak Ciabatta combo.  The dressing is not overpowering.
Croutons are crunchy but not stale.

The iced almond white mocha and chai latte are great
choices to drink.

Almost forgot the dessert.  Cannot go wrong with the
strawberry shortcake or fresh fruits.

What I like about this place is that you are in
a high caliber establishment without feeling stiffed.

Came here to go over a business idea.
As we left, each got a mint stick.

Pluses:
+ Comfortable, clean, and relatively quiet seating
+ Friendly and attentive service
+ Great tasting well-portioned dishes at a decent price
+ Great tea and salad
+ Not a high turn-over environment
+ Clean bathroom
+ Parking lot

Minuses:
- No expresso drinks

Tips:
* Get the half salad-half sandwich combo or the 
half sandwich-half soup combo, so you don't have
to wear elastic pants or suspenders.
author: CT L.

description: I honestly find myself coming here A LOT. They have a lot of good lunch options, but just beware, it gets really busy during the lunch hour so seating can be quite limited! I wish they didn't take out the shrimp louie salad because that was my favorite! ): Now I usually order the salmon ceasar or their yummy tomato soup. The food comes out quite fast, even on a busy day. I recently tried something new, and it was their angel hair pasta with salmon and asparagus. I have to say I didn't like it at all. There was way too much cheese, and it was extremely oily on the bottom. I'll stick to my usual's from now on.
author: Marilyn W.

description: Eating here for the first time now.  Giving this one star because despite the fact that the food is tasty and the table wait staff were pleasant,it took 15 minutes just to place an order.  There was only one person at the cash register, and he kept stepping away to fill orders even though there were 6+ people behind the counter at the time and a full staff in the kitchen.  Because of this, the line was out the door of the cafe.  I mentioned how shocked I was to the waiter who delivered my order, and he offered to bring me a survey form.  What I got instead was a pen and a scrap piece of paper.  This experience was definitely not up to snuff for Nordstom's customer service standards.  Hope the restaurant manager reads this and addressee the situation ASAP.  Entirely disappointing.  Hope it improves soon.
author: Carrie W.

description:
If you're looking to escape the noisy Stonestown food court because you have an unusually splitting headache (like yours truly), or if you're just looking for a quiet place to grab a bite to eat while having a decent one on one conversation with someone, definitely come to the Nordstrom Cafe. I've never seen it crowded so it's a quiet and spacious cafe. Their menu is small and the food will not blow your taste buds out of the water, but the food is pretty good and the portions are not bad either.

Here's the deal: You order and pay upfront, grab a seat anywhere you want (they have about 20, if not more, tables and each table can comfortably seat four people), and then a waiter/waitress will bring you your meal. They're fast too, probably because this place does not get crowded. Oh well, works for me. :)
author: Narina A.

description: One of my favorite spots for lunch when shopping with my mom at Nordie's. Been coming here since I was a kid and I have to say that the food just keeps getting better. I love the variety of salads that they have and the sandwiches they have are all pretty great. Only reason why this place didn't get 5 stars is that if it's busy finding a place to sit really sucks. Otherwise I highly recommend it.
author: Tori M.

description:
they hv the best tuna melt!! also love the clam chowder but they only offer that on firday now...the only thing that i dont like is their chips...too thick and not crispy...coffee is always hot and strong...tried their dessert once, not too many choices but still okay...
it's a nice place to sit down, chat w/ friends and hvave something to eat place in stionestown...will always go back there...(^^!)
author: Elsa W.

description:
The food is wonderful!!!  It's always so good and fresh, yummy!  My usual meal is a cup of the tomato bisque and the salmon ceasar salad.  I'm drooling thinking about it.  

Service is excellent too.  The servers are so curteous and attentive.  

Go to Nords Cafe, you won't be disappointed.
author: L C.

description:
One word to describe this experience:

DIARRHEA.

I was good on the way down, but bad on the way out.

Do not order the chicken tomato alfredo!
author: Nance W.

description:
The Spiced Chai Tea Latte here is the best thing I've ever put in my mouth... Ok second best... right next to the occasional Peanut Butter/Guacamole sandwich combo... What? It's a man thing. 

Anyway... I'd describe the chai how Jimmy Fallon describes his dire dedication to the Boston Redsox, in the movie Fever Pitch:

"So where do you place the Nordstrom Spiced Chai Tea Latte in your life, Sani?"

Sani- "It's the Chai Tea Latte, sex and breathing."

If you're ever in the Stonestown Galleria, for about 2 bucks, you can treat yourself to great happiness in a cup, then with all the joy in you, walk off to Victoria Secret and pick out some panties/manties for yourself. :D
author: Sani S.

description: I went for lunch with my parents and ordered the mixed berry salad. It came with candied walnuts, goat cheese, and chicken break, with a tasty vinaigrette, and a good portion size about $13. My dad had the chicken lime salad, same deal, and my mom had a half salad half soup combo. The price was reasonable, and everything tasted good. Probably not a good place to go if I was really hungry, though. Definitely classier than the Stonestown food court, but not suffocatingly so. It got a lot more crowded by the noon mark, though. I get a feeling that a lot of people come to Nordstrom to buy lunch and not clothes.
author: Kim D.

description:
I can't believe I've never stepped into this Cafe whenever I'm at Nordstrom. Well today I did and I'm glad I did! The cafe looks so nice inside, you know those kind of Cafes where you just want to sit there for hours just to chit chat? YEAH it looks like one of those. 

I wasn't that hungry when we came here so I just went for the soup of the day. It was chicken pot pie with a slice of Parmesan cheese bread. Even though the meal wasn't out of the ordinary I still enjoyed eating there. Some of us had the tuna melt and that looked mouth watering. Another friend of ours got the tomato basil pasta? And that looked scrumptious too! I have to come back to try those. After our meal the nice waitress gave us chocolate mint sticks! That swept me off my feet. 

Nordstrom Cafe you'll be seeing more of me!
author: Tracy A.

description: LOVE the french dip sandwich. Foods good and everyone is laid back and really nice. I come here time to time to sit for a meal or take out. The menu had a good amount of choices and the atmosphere is pretty nice.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Only two things make me come to Nordstroms...Mac Cosmetics and the Cafe.  I gotta say, the Cafe is way more cost effective!  The food is yummy, just the right portion, and not very expensive.  The staff is friendly, polite, and sharply dressed.  My faves are their soups, their turkey sammiches on ciabatta (sp?), and the apple-goat cheese-and-chicken salad.  

Sometimes the jazz music gets a little loud-ish, but it's a nice change from listening to a bunch of folks talking, munching, etc.  The crowd is made up of a lot of regulars.  This is definitely the best place to eat while at Stonestown!  Your alternatives are the food court (yuck), Chevy's (I go to the Mission for real Mexican food), and Olive Garden (I don't even have to say how wrong that place is).
author: Sheila G.

description: Their California Grill Sandwich is off the hoook!! Sooo gooood and on the days I couldn't eat big I would just order from the kids menu LOL which was pretty cool that they let me order there with out IDing me haha.  The kids chicken tenders with BBQ are soooo good, I swear those have to be the best chicken tenders I've ever had! Also, there is nothing like a place that serves a grilled cheese with a side of tomato soup :) yummmm thank youuu Nordstrom Cafe! This is actually a lot better place to eat at if you get headaches from all the people and crying kids at the mall's food court.
author: Christina O.

description:
HELL to the YES! 

I've been a long-time patron of the Nordstrom Bistro Cafe located downtown on the top story of the San Fransisco Center, but oddly enough, I never managed to get around to eating at the Stonestown Nordstrom Cafe until today. 

The menu is quite different than at the downtown location...it's a little more basic and lower-priced, with more sandwich options...essentially, the menu is less "bistro" and more just "cafe." The quality of food that Nordstrom serves, however, (similar to the merchandise they carry!) is superb. They really know how to throw a little something together!

I had the half sandwich/cup of soup & salad combo with the tuna salad and the tomato soup. Everything was soooo good, from the crostini to the salad dressing! It was a reasonable portion, I thought...just the right amount of food so I didn't get overly full! 

Anyways...the food court at Stonestown will pretty much never be getting my business from now on (with the exception of Mrs. Fields and Love Berry)...too bad for them!
author: Shannon R.

description:
For a mall, this option is actually pretty nice. They have soup and salad and sandwiches and pastas. They even have beer and wine. They have my favorite tea, mighty leaf tea. The servers are sweet and they give you chocolate mint straws at the end. 

I especially like having conversation with the several elderly folks that come here to pass the time and to lunch.
author: Amanda L.

description: I really like their Citrus Salmon Cesar Salad and they have great service.  My mother and I enjoy having lunch here when shopping at the mall.
author: Flo S.

description:
I've been eating here for over ten years...I've seen it remodeled about a half dozen times, but they still deliver with the goods. This is not by any means the spot to go to if you want to look hip--it's at Stonestown.

The patrons are mostly 50+, but it's okay. Steak ciabatta sandwich...California grill...tomato basil soup...everything here is the jump off. For a while they were still only charging .25c for a cup of coffee.

I'm already snitching too hard. Nordstrom Cafe til I die.
author: Sidney L.

description: Food is good. I especially like the salmon sandwich and the tuna melt. I think it's kinda pricey for being in a mall. Service is okay. There has been times where I have to get up and get my own drink refill. They offer nice pastries. Weekends and school holidays are super busy.
author: Jessica M.

description:
This place serves much better food than anything you can find in the food court. Granted, the menu is pretty limited to a few soups, salads, sandwiches and 3 pasta dishes but the sandwiches are fantastic when you're not in the mood for a huge meal. I had the turkey and cranberry sandwich and my boyfriend had the albacore tuna and avocado. The sandwiches were huge! You could easily eat half and save the other half for later. 

Service is prompt and efficient. The waitress checked up on us twice and our glasses were never empty. I'm not saying this is somewhere you would take a date but if you're tired of shopping, hungry and want a quick meal, I can't think of a better place in this area.
author: Nathalie L.

description:
The menu items are decent, a cut above mall fare.  We go here because it's convenient and more quiet than the other Stonestown choices.   

The down side is the service when one is only having a beverage.   It is very inefficient waiting for the server to come by to pick up our order slip just for a drink.    We've waited over 10 minutes, at times.  I end up walking back to counter to present my order. They are rarely busy whenever we go.    

The latest disappointment is the size of the red velvet cake.  Sure, the price is lower, but the slice was so small I thought it was going to topple over.  I'd pay the original price for a decent slice.  

We have no other choices so we'll keep going.  Guess I shouldn't complain, huh?  I hope I can at least carry my own coffee from the cashier to my table when I'm not ordering food, next time we go.  .
author: Debbie T.

description:
I love the Nordstrom Cafe! 
The cafe is located on the bottom level of Nordstrom.  

It's the perfect place to stop & eat after shopping all day! 
It's also perfect for a lunch break!

The menu is simple: soups, salads, sandwiches, pasta! And delicious muffins! 
You walk to the register, order & find a table. Then the waiters bring you your beverage & food!

I ordered the combo of soup, salad & sandwich. I had never send this combo before but it was just right for lunch!

When I'm out shopping, I like to stop here for a muffin & fresh coffee...yummy!
author: Stephanie M.

description: The half sandwich salad and soup was great! One of the best tuna salad sandwiches I've had. The cream of tomato was tasty. The parmesan toast was really good. And you have to try the blueberry muffin-- very moist and delicious.
author: Nori L.

description:
I really really like eating here for those days when I'm not quite sure what I'm craving for.  They have these meals which include a half-sandwich, salad and soup, and they always have the greatest SOUPS!  The salads are always perfect with just the right amount of vinaigrette.

You order and pay first.  Then find your own seat until a server makes their way to your table.  They always introduce themselves to you and ask you if you'd like any drinks.  One little inconvenience is that they don't have espresso drinks at the cafe - they only sell them at the kiosk outside the main Nordstrom lower level entrance to the mall.

Service has always been efficient and professional.  For some reason, they often have regular customers (mostly Seniors living in the surrounding area).  

It's a great, spacious, clean dining area and also serve pastries and slices of cake/pie for dessert also).  Along with your final check, you receive chocolate mint sticks which are worth the visit alone!  (they sell them at the front register, along with their cookbook and a variety of their salad dressings, for which they're known).
author: Olma M.

description:
One of the only reasons to come to Stonestown anymore after my mall rat days have gone...

I try to get something different every time, and not once have I been disappointed! Yesterday's special, the vegetarian sandwich, was AMAZING. Gooey avocado, swiss cheese, sundried tomatoes, fresh alfalfa sprouts, cucumber, and lettuce... on a toasted wheat ciabatta. I'm not even vegetarian, and that might be one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. And the best I've felt after a filling meal.

Still surprisingly a well kept secret, always seating available. Perfect down to the mint chocolate with your receipt, this place is golden.
author: Sandra S.

description:
My bi-weekly routine:  11:30am, head down to Nordstrom Cafe, order lunch, wave hello to Grace, and quickly sit in her section on the comfy booths.  Enjoy Tomato Basil Soup with Crostini, then Chicken Caesar Salad. 2 hours later, order a huge slice of Carrot Cake.  The cake is nice and soft, with pecans, raisins and pineapples inside.  The cream cheese layers are perfect and not overdone at all. Great amount of everying in each bite.  My absolute favorite dessert!   

For me, its my favorite place to study now-a-days.  Screw the library and cafes with uncomfortable wooden seating.  Nordstrom Cafe is the way to go if you really need to cram in a study session.  Be sure to sit in Graces' section.  She is super nice, accomodating, and very quick.
author: Cass J.

description:
Mmm!

It took employment at Nordstrom to get me over here, but it was well worth it! Great little indoor cafe on the 1st floor of Nordstrom...they offer amazing hot sandwiches, soups, huge salads, pastas, and various daily entrees. On my lunch break, I used to get their half salad-half sandwich combo...for $5. Great deal! Go for the Steak Ciabatta, California Grill, or Albacore Tuna Melt.......to die for!! Also, don't forget to ask for croutons with your salad..they are mini pieces of fried bread from heaven!!!!!!!
author: Jessica h.

description:
I have been here many times and ordered the same dish - angel hair pasta with salmon and asparagus for $10.50! What a deal! Atmosphere is much better than the food court area. If you go to Panda or Great Steak, you'd spend about $8.00. Spend $2 more, it's worth it!

Today, they were super busy with every table occupied. Although, despite of it, the servers and bust boys were on top of everything. I especially commend the manager for working so hard bringing out food and being so pleasant to customers.
author: Lauren R.

description:
3.5 stars....Great Avocado Goddess chicken salad! My boyfriend's parents had a french dip which looked good as well and a breakfast plate which also looked really good.  Cheap, quick, and pretty good. 
Iced coffee was yummy. Don't go for the bottled teas...those things are nasty!
author: Courtney M.

description: It's a simple place for staple foods, and for me, a place to get away from the busy mall atmosphere. It's quiet enough to chat freely without screaming and private enough to chat freely.
author: Michael G.

description:
Heeeeyyyy Seniors! This is the place to be if you're in the 60+ demographic.  At least during the lunch hours. Love it!

I come here at least once a month with my Popo [grandma] and we love it! 

You order at the counter, pay, then find a place to sit and your food is delivered to your table.

Service is great, portions are perfect, and prices are pretty cheap.   I almost always get the California Grill - Turkey, Avocado, Bacon, Swiss Cheese, Tomato on Grilled Sourdough Bread with a side of salad....my mouth is watering right now...! 

SIDENOTE: It can get pretty busy at lunch. Seniors know how to dine!
author: Kira O.

description:
I am updating my feedback as I have to let fans of Nordstroms Cafe know about their latest  daily specials. Last few times I been there I was sold on the extremely delicious smoked turkey and wild rice soup (hearty, delicious and low sodium), calamari salad and curry chicken sandwich. To my surprise, they brought back the Shrimp Louie Salad that was served daily for an entire week! Talk about wishful thinking! Don't forget the delicious crostini bread offered with the soup! They should sell those  in packs as those are addicting!

Service once again has been outstanding and Bobby has delivered top quality customer service always making me feel welcome. Six stars to Nordstroms Cafe at Stonestown!
author: Kitty M.

description: I really like this place. I love their clam chowder! It's slightly different than the traditional New England clam chowder. Also, their salmon angel hair pasta is excellent. The location is great and so are the prices. I like the fact that I get to pick my own seat and it's usually not too busy so I get a little bit of privacy. The service could be a bit better though.
author: Diane M.

description:
Surprisingly terrific.
I had the tuna melt and the cob salad (on romaine) with the balsamic dressing.  BOTH were very good.  The coffee was delicious and HOT.  The service was confusing at first - one orders and pays first - then chooses a table - THEN the server takes over.  The restaurant was clean, and for being in the basement with absolutely no windows, still comfortable and inviting. 
I'd go back.  (-:
author: p. k.

description: I just ate breakfast here this morning. The service was friendly, the food was hot and fresh. This location was in the news recently because of a sick worker. They are doing everything right to address the issue. While I was there they must have answered 10-15 phone calls of anxious customers. They were patient, polite, clear and to the point. I will return and recommend that all the customer do as well.
author: Lisa B.

description: Amazing cafe food. Everything I've gotten from this place is awesome. The French Dip, the tuna melt, angel hair with salmon, the BLT with turkey and avocado.... It's shockingly good.. Especially for a restaurant in the basement of a store. I go to Stonestown just to eat there. The best Tuna Melt I've ever had.
author: Art L.

description: It's aight. I work at Nordstrom so I eat here alot which doesn't affect my view in anyway. I agree with alot of customer's it's a bit overly priced when you consider the small portions they server. The quality of the food is decent but what I believe to be the best bang for your buck would be the Kids Grilled Cheese Sandwich meal. Its less than 5 bucks and you get a Grilled Cheese Sandwich, a cup of frutis, a cup of tomato basil soup (or the soup of the day), and chips. It's actually too big of a portion to be a kids meal if you ask me.
author: Aaron F.

description: I love this place: I think Nordstrom Cafe has become one of my new favorite spots for lunch. I had the soup of the day (New England Clam Chowder) and the California sandwich (came with avocado, bacon, tomato, and lettuce). The food was delicious and was brought to our table while it was still hot, and the servers did a pretty good job of serving our food and making sure we didn't have any extra requests. Although the food is a bit pricey, the atmosphere is very quiet and relaxing: makes a great place for a peaceful lunch during your lunch break or to have a conversation amongst your friends.
author: Felix C.

description: When I'm in the mall and want a good cup of coffee and descent meal I would come to Nordstrom Cafe. Lots of older folks and families hanging around so kinda quiet but busy. I haven't gone wrong with their food, I've had the Turkey cranberry sammy, YUM! The shrimp Louis salad, good portion no huge not small and about 6 giant prawns! The Chicken apple salad is also real good. It's a bit pricey but it's good simple fresh food.
author: Karen T.

description:
We thought Nordstrom Cafe was our last hope because there really isn't any good food in the mall. We were wrong :(
Portions were too little, their "specialty" angel hair + salmon was sour.. very strange..
Santa Fe Chicken tasted decent.
Prices seriously isn't worth the quality and quantity of some of the food.
author: Roland R.

description: The food is quite tasty---but line and strange set-up are inappropriate at this price point (a sandwich, soda and soup were nearly $20). Nordstrom: either offer a premium product at a premium price, or offer something fast at a better value.
author: Cameron K.

description: My family comes here at least once a week.  The food is clean and tasty and budget friendly.  It is also very kid friendly.
author: S C.

description:
I've been in San Francisco all my life and going to Stonestown for many years, but never ventured into this restaurant.  A friend of mine took me here to have lunch. I was pleasantly surprised.

He ordered a half sandwich with soup. I ordered a berry salad.  I do not know the exact names, (sorry if this makes me a bad reviewer) but the food was quite delicious.  

For a eatery inside a "shopping" complex, the ambiance was quite pleasant. Most of the people inside were shoppers and people on their lunch breaks, but it wasn't rowdy or too loud.  The waiters were helpful and quick.  

I need to try more food to really know this place, so sit tight, this review might just change!
author: A L.

description: Went to Nordy's cafe the other day, and I don't know if it was just a bad day or something but my husband and I experienced the worst service ever!  I've been to pther Nordy Cafes (ie: Stanford & hillsdale), a number of times and they were always superb in their customer service.  But the Stonestown Cafe really didn't do it for me.  We were ignored for about 10 minutes while we sat at our table waiting for a waitress to take our order reciept, then tney got my order wrong, and on top of all that they were rude and barely spoke to us the entire time.  ...Definately experienced better.
author: Nicole G.

description: Ok so first i must recommend the California Grill, it is so great. They used to have a pasta dish that was great but the California Grill is much better. The service is pretty good, i've never had any really problems other than today me and my girlfriends were waiting a little long for them to take our order and then the guy was kind of rude. not to mention i asked for italian dressing, and he gave me a totally different one, other than that i always have a great experience there.
author: Nia W.

description: I'd go here on my break when I worked at Stonestown. It was like sitting in a fancy dining restaurant even though it's settled in the middle of a teeny bopper hell. I personally liked getting the grilled cheese combo or if I was feeling more adult-like, I'd get a chicken ranch club sandwich. Now I'm no fan of vegetables, but the tomato soup there RAWKS. You also get some kick-ass mints at the end of the meal and unlimited refills on root beer. All for under 10 bucks.
author: Chino B.

description: The place to go if you want nutritious and delicious food at the Stonestown Galleria hands down. Their soup is amazing.
author: Judy L.

description: I love, love, love Nordstrom Cafe. Yay for Nordstrom Cafe!! Their salads and sandwiches are good. However, I try not to eat here often (I just can't help myself though!!) because it can take a toll on your wallet. Overall, it's a cute place to eat and the food is good.
author: C. T.

description: In short, my girlfriend and I have been coming here all the time!  Our favorites include:  The tomato basil soup to start, and absolutely the angel hair pasta with salmon and asparagus.  Absolutely.
author: Michael B.

description: I love love love this place.  I love their sandwiches, very fresh and juicy.  Their cookies and iced almond white mocha are very good too.  I just love this place for a quick lunch or hi-tea when I go shopping with my friends.
author: Josie K W.

description:
the nordstrom cafe in sf centre stopped offering the california grill, or at least they did the last time i checked.  so yay for the stonestown one for still having it on their menu.  this used to be my go-to lunch item way way back.  and i was so delighted to get to have it again recently.  definitely greasy but oh so delicious.  and they carry 4 types of republic of tea.  i like!

service is decent too.  you order and pay at the counter and then bring your receipt to a table of your choice.  then a server comes to see what you've ordered (instead of using the number flag system).  and they're pretty good about drink refills and checking if everything's alright.  dining room is a tad dark but otherwise, it's a nice quick meal, but fancier than eating at the food court.
author: spiff e.

description: Tasty sandwiches, tomato bisque, and cobb salad. It's a great place to sneak in a quick little lunch break or grab a bite and relax while shopping.
author: Angie L.

description: Consistently good service and good food.  The basalmic dressing is wonderful as is the albacore melt.
author: Erin M.

description: was very disappointed with lunch today.  been going here for years and they keep changing the menu.  i found one dish i really enjoyed and it was taken off the menu.  i would try different menu items and finally i found the tuna and avocado sandwich which i liked.  today, they changed the menu and the tuna sandwich was gone.  ordered a turkey and cranberry sandwich and it was very dry.  not sure why they keep changing their menu, but it doesn't work for me.  i will not go back to this cafe again.
author: Steve C.

description:
i don't like the fact that the place seems so hidden away from everything... i always forget that this place actually exists...
the few times i've gone there was to get a pastry or something, and they've tasted good...
author: charlotte s.

description: The tomato soup is to die for!!!!! Pair it up with their grilled cheese and you'll be set! Their waiters are extremely friendly and attentive. i love going to this place! everything i've ordered i've enjoyed! grilled cheese and the soup is still my favorite though.
author: stephanie c.

description: Hands down the best food spot in the mall. Had the Turkey BLT with avocado and side salad.  I'll never go back to the food court ever again.
author: Robin L.

description: I love Nordstrom Café. I don't do much shopping at Nordies but when I do this is a great place for dessert and coffee after shopping. It's close to my work and has great views. The service is great and their menu is pretty consistent with seasonal changes to make things interesting. Their café latte is well-made (light and not over-roasted) and their desserts are warm from the oven versus heated in a microwave. The strawberries have always been fresh--a big plus.
author: Christian D.

description: We come here often not necessarily for the food, but sometimes just to get away from a noisy typical restaurant.  The selection is limited and the prices are typical Nordstrom - a little on the high side.  You order in a cafeteria line style and then a server brings the food to you.  The service seems to be good and the atmosphere is quiet and it doesn't seem to busy.  The food is good and adequate unless you are the type that is looking for quantity.
author: Robert J.

description: I order the same thing everytime: The California Grill - simply the best. Make sure you order the salad with ranch dressing. Always nice to dip some of the sandwich in the ranch. Hungry just thinking about it.
author: Michael W.

description: I used to work at Stonestown and I have never eaten at Nordstrom Cafe until a few weeks ago. I ordered the tomato soup and a BLT which was delicious. The sandwich was really clean (didnt fall apart all over) and the bacon was crunchy and tasty. My favorite thing was the little parmesian bread stick on the soup. If you love tomato soup and you are at stonestown dont go to boudin and get it. Go here its better. Plus you get a little mint afterwards. yay for freebies.
author: andree t.

description:
this was my home and work for a year and a half ... three managers and found the one i truly disliked and disappointed in as a manager and a "pretender "... now the food,:  since post breakup its been okay, nothing nordstrom-like to speak of, committment to quality and presentation;  like the current manager:  is lacking, it 's pro-forma, spec cooking ... and it taste like it, somewhat like the store .. this is what it is ... and when i was there, it was not!  nor the crew,  who I was happy to be associated with as friends as professional cooks ...

oh the possiblities, that will never be fulfilled, because nordstrom's myoptic vision on trends:  fashion and food ... we call that visionary!  not follow the leader ..

the friends I have left there, continue to be professional and friendly and helpful, that is a given that will never change ... because good as well as not so good people, dont!

former employee, stockholder, and all around good guy
author: tim y.

description: Was there for lunch last week with lady friends before a matinee. We had a reservation for noon and were seated promptly.  Service was very nice.  Crab salad was fresh and good, although seemed small for the price.  I would go again for the convenience, but overall seemed pricey.
author: Cindy L.

description:
I use to eat here when I went to SF State because the food court was too inundated with immature high schoolers and middle school aged kids. It's not the most "classy" Nordstrom Cafe, but it's more than good enough for a light and casual dining experience in Stonestown. 

Lunch was always about the soups and salads. You order at the counter and a waiter brings it to you promptly. Prices are okay and the setting is very soothing and woody (lots of dark browns and greens) that make you feel like you're in a Friar's Club lounge. Still, very worthy of the three stars.
author: Stan H.

description:
Having visited the famous Stonestown uncountable times in my life, I was embarrassed to never have known that this little "hole in the wall" existed. I guess my unfamiliarity with Nordstrom justifies that. 

I was not very impressed. Expensive prices, slow service and small food selections. Tons of seating though (unless it's crowded). I got a sandwich which turned out to be a mess of cheese and grease. My friend got a cornbread-pork experiment with soggy cornbread. It was a busy day, so I probably should be more fair, but the food was not what I expected it to be (especially when the atmosphere is so much more high end).

2 Stars. It's a convenient location, but the food quality and prices are not what they should be at all.
author: Danny D.

description: Don't know that there is a better tuna melt in the country.  I don't even shop at Nordstrom, but I go there for the tuna melts!
author: Todd R.

description:
I was pretty hesitant on liking this place since, 1) I never knew it exisited and 2) my almost 70 year old Chinese great-aunt suggested it for good "western" food.

But we go in and order, in true asian fashion, she tries to fight me at the register. I haded the cashier the money and my aunt lunged at her and threw her money at the poor girl servicing us. To spare her, I backed off and let my aunt pay for us.

My mother, great-aunt and I sat down at a table for 4 and we were served our drinks very promptly. Our sandwiches came at the same time and they were much larger than expected (that's what she said.) The three of us shared a California Grilled Sandwich and fresh fruit salad and a Veggie Sandwich and salad with thousand island dressing on the side. I didn't have the California (it had bacon and chicken, and I don't like meat) but I very much enjoyed the Veggie sandwich. There we sprouts, spinach, sundried tomatoes, cucumbers, the usual, but what impressed me was their use of aoili. Most restaurants cover the taste of vegetables with their spreads and sauces in their "veggie" sandwiches. But in this sandwich, the aoili was incredibly light. They weren't just being stingy either, it was just enough to enhance the taste of everything, but not so much that it was the only thing you could taste. 

Once we looked done, our waitress handed us the "tip bill". Little did she know, my aunt is a chatterbox that takes half an hour to finish a sandwich and another half hour to finish her coffee. It was nice though since I didn't feel at all rushed to leave.

Good food, good service. I'd come back.
author: Virginia C.

description: I have been here quite a few times and have never had a bad experience. The sandwiches, salads, and soups are consistently fresh and tasty. MUCH better than the food court. My grown daughter and I call it a "ladies who lunch" place - but she and her friends and young students from SF state go there as well - as well as us "older" and/or retired folks. Pleasant servers for the most part, and chocolate mint sticks besides!
author: Gale H.

description: I had lunch with a former professor (from spring semester, with a fabulous sense of humor) and it was his idea to go Nordstrom Cafe. Since I never ate there, I was being hella picky until I ordered the Santa Fe Chicken sandwich with salad. I forgot what sandwich he ordered, but that's okay. All I got to say is that the Santa Fe Chicken sandwich is HELLA GOOD!!!! despite the sandwich being oily. I enjoy the ambience of the cafe (my professor made fun of the people in the cafe, which cracked me up) because I needed it because I was stressing out over a midterm I was going to take the next day. While I was there, I felt like the hostess and waiter were staring at us (me and my former professor), that creeped me out. Overall, I would come back here again for lunch.
author: Chinwe N.

description: why oh why have some people given beyond one star for this place?? I don't understand it at all.  I was initally drawn in by the restaurant like feel within the Nordstrom's.  The first thing I notice as I pick up the menu is that there is hardly a selection of food.  There were two choices of pastas, I believe two choices in sandwiches, and four salads to choose from.  Since when does a restaurant have more salads than entrees? When I go into a restaurant I want to eat food, not trees...I ordered a soup and sandwich combo for $8.95.  Described as  turkey sandwich with avocado, tomato, and lettuce, a side of tomato basil soup, and garlic cheese crostini on the side.  It sounds fabulous, and I'm not too concerned about the price because I'm getting a lot of stuff, right?? The food comes out ten minutes later, and on my plate, I see the smallest half sandwich I've ever seen, with a tiny little bowl of pink paint colored soup, no bigger than the size of a post it, and a pathetic sliver of bread they call a crostini.  The sandwich was below average, the soup tasted like an overly pureed dipping sauce, and the sliver of crostini was the best tasting part of the meal.  I finished the sandwich and the crostini, and left the paint soup atop my nine dollar plate.  I'd say the best part of my experience here was when they brought out these dark chocolate mint sticks along with the check.  The Nordstrom's shopping experience=SUPERB, the cafe on the other hand seemed to be made only for anorexics without tastebuds
author: Chow Mein Ninj A.

description: Haven't been to this Cafe in 10 Years and how it has changed!  You can find it in the lower floor of the Norstrom store in the Stonestown Mall area.  The ambience is the same muted colors, with warm furnishings and  waiters/waitresses service.  You still place your orders through the cafeteria-like lines, but the (in our case) waitress  name "Glem" brough us our lunch.  I asked for my order in a take out container and to eat at the cafe.  The casher informed me that their policy is you can eat in but cannot have a take out container - only when you are leaving.  My guests ordered (shared)  Cheesy Steak Mushroom Sandwich on ciabatta roll  ($9.95)and their own bowl of tomatoe Basil Soup ($4.50).  Their soup of the day was Apple Lentil. ($4.50 for bowl, and $3.50 for cup)  My other guests both ordered the Salmon Angel Hair Pasta ($9.95).   I, of course, went for their cheesy steak sandwich as well since you have a choice of salad(salad dressings are ranch, thousand island, or vinegarette) or chips included.  My sandwich was more than "yummy" --- with the cheesy over the fresh mushrooms and beef were tender and hot.  The ciabatta was crunchy , well-lightly toasted.  My companions all enjoyed their meals as well.  However, one wished her Salmon Angel Hair Pasta had more grated cheese on it.  I would suggest that the wait person should have come with a bowl of grated cheese and asked if anyone wanted more on their plate.  It was a full house with families, senior citizens, etc.  - shoppers.  I've learned that during the peak hours (lunch time) it would have a long queue out the door.  The special dessert was Strawberry Shortcake (but I've noticed that it is on their regular dessert menu).  Tea Time Service!  Now, that surprised me.  The Cafe carry an assortment of teas and  tarts, fresh fruits (mixed or berries with whipped cream and a cookie), assorted cookies, pies and cakes (carrot).   I plan to go back for that Strawberry Shortcake - ---probably sonner than later!
author: Marian G.

description: Man, do I love lunching at Nordstrom Cafe !  Convenient, parking, fairly reasonably priced, fast and efficient service.  Especially crave the California Grill Sandwich.  Excellent place for a nice meal and a visit with friends.
author: Mary N.

description: The Bread Pudding is the BEST!   The pear salad is awesome!  The cioppino is only okay, and not that good.  The asian chicken salad is okay too.  Service is pretty good.  Will come back for the BREAD PUDDING!!!
author: Yelper Y.

description: Excellent food, fresh, tasty, nothing exotic but you never leave unhappy. Spotless clean restaurant and neat if harried waiting staff. The champagne dressing is lovely though they are stingy with the very nice toasted bread. A suprisingly good cafe within a store. Around noon you can experience a long wait for a sandwich and depending where you sit you have to flag down a waiter to get attention.
author: alex b.

description: Ok - the 1 star is probably a bit too harsh and it is in response to their recent decision to drop their one and only vegetarian sandwich from the menu.  It also goes to show the complete disconnect between the people who run the cafe with the growing population who want a healthy option.  We've been coming here for many years.  We've enjoyed their portobello sandwich which went away and was replaced by a vegetarian panini (tomatoes, sprouts, sundried tomatoes, avocado, cucumber).  Now they even took that away.  Faced with no other option on the menu other than a "green salad" we asked if they could put together a sandwich.  They said the only thing they could add only what was available in their kitchen -  lettuce, tomatoes and cucumber.  I had to ask about the avocado and they said yes.  Ordered it anyway because we were with a group of friends and didn't want to have to find an alternative dining spot (try Cocola near the entrance across from Williams Sonoma).  Sandwich turned out to be BORING - plus they charged me the price of the most expensive sandwich.  I've written to Nordstroms who promised to send me a response - that was 2 weeks ago.  Won't be returning until they add more vegetarian options.  How difficult can this be?  I can't imagine we're the only ones out there....
author: Will L.

description: Great for lunch, away from the crowds upstairs at the mall. I love their tomato soup and half sandwich combo.
author: Stella G.
